His frighteningly exceptional prowess in Legilimency allowed Voldemort to delve and peer deep into the minds of others without needing to say the incantation or using his wand, seeing their deepest thoughts, and he can even use Legilimency to influence the minds that he invaded. <a href="/wiki/Severus_Snape" title="Severus Snape">Severus Snape</a> has stated that Voldemort could not only read, but also control and unhinge the minds of others, often enjoying invading the minds of others, creating lifelike visions designed to torture them into madness (such as the one he sent to <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter" title="Harry Potter">Harry Potter</a> in <a href="/wiki/1996" title="1996">1996</a>), and only killing them 'after extracting the last exquisite ounce of agony', when he had them literally begging for death. He was also able to use Legilimency to briefly possess Harry, even though he had already regained a physical body, which caused Harry so much pain that he even begged for death. Hence, Voldemort could almost always tell when someone was lying. However, when <a href="/wiki/Narcissa_Malfoy" title="Narcissa Malfoy">Narcissa Malfoy</a> lied that Harry Potter was dead, Voldemort notably believed her.<sup id="cite_ref-OOTP_31-11" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-OOTP-31"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>31<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> The most remarkable part about this skill was that he seemed to have already been able to consciously use it while he was still a child in the orphanage. Extremely few people were skilled enough in <a href="/wiki/Occlumency" title="Occlumency">Occlumency</a> to shield themselves from him. <a href="/wiki/Severus_Snape" title="Severus Snape">Severus Snape</a>, <a href="/wiki/Albus_Dumbledore" title="Albus Dumbledore">Albus Dumbledore</a>, <a href="/wiki/Gellert_Grindelwald" title="Gellert Grindelwald">Gellert Grindelwald</a>, and also possibly <a href="/wiki/Narcissa_Malfoy" title="Narcissa Malfoy">Narcissa Malfoy</a> were notably the only known ones able to block out Voldemort's Legilimency using Occlumency. Additionally, Harry Potter, despite his link to Voldemort's mind, discovered that he could block Voldemort's intrusions into his mind by feeling love, as direct contact with Harry's mind while he was feeling love was excruciatingly painful for Voldemort with his maimed and diminished soul.<sup id="cite_ref-DH_27-16" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DH-27"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>27<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Using his mastery of Occlumency, Voldemort was able to block his connection to Harry, preventing him from seeing what he is doing, although it could be broken through when Voldemort was angered enough, which became increasingly so due to Voldemort's volatile temper rising from the exhaustive search for the Elder Wand and the destruction of his Horcruxes. While it's unknown if Severus Snape or Albus Dumbledore ever attempted Legilimency on him, it's likely that neither would be able to penetrate his mind despite being skilled Legilimens themselves. Dumbledore also feared that Voldemort could use Legilimency on <a href="/wiki/Draco_Malfoy" title="Draco Malfoy">Draco Malfoy</a> to discover any potential confrontation over the young man's <a href="/wiki/Plot_to_assassinate_Albus_Dumbledore" title="Plot to assassinate Albus Dumbledore">mission</a> despite Draco learning Occulumency, suggesting Voldemort's skills were able to penetrate Occulumency if the target is not strong enough.<sup id="cite_ref-HBP_17-24" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HBP-17"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>17<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li></ul>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows">"<i>Voldemort was flying like smoke on the wind, without <a href="/wiki/Broomstick" title="Broomstick">broomstick</a> or <a href="/wiki/Thestral" title="Thestral">Thestral</a> to hold him, his snakelike face gleaming out of the blackness, his white fingers raising his wand again –</i>"</span></dd>
<dd>— Voldemort flying without support during the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_the_Seven_Potters" title="Battle of the Seven Potters">Battle of the Seven Potters</a><sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows" title="Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows">[src]</a></sup></dd>
<dd></dd></dl></div>
<ul><li><b><a href="/wiki/Flight" title="Flight">Flying</a></b>: Voldemort was able, and invented the ability, <a href="/wiki/Unsupported_flight" title="Unsupported flight">to fly without support</a>, defying the law of magic that states objects can only fly through use of a flying charm. He first exhibited this flying ability when in pursuit of <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter" title="Harry Potter">Harry Potter</a> over <a href="/wiki/Little_Whinging" title="Little Whinging">Little Whinging</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-DH_27-17" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DH-27"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>27<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> He frequently used his ability to fly throughout the Second Wizarding War, and was known to have taught Severus Snape how to duplicate the feat.</li></ul>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince">"<i>I can speak to snakes. I found out when we've been to the country on trips — they find me, they whisper to me. Is that normal for a wizard?</i>"</span></dd>
<dd>— A young Tom Riddle telling Albus Dumbledore about his ability to communicate with snakes<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Half-Blood_Prince" title="Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince">[src]</a></sup></dd>
<dd></dd></dl></div>
<ul><li><b><a href="/wiki/Parseltongue" title="Parseltongue">Parseltongue</a></b>: Voldemort was a Parselmouth, a trait he inherited from his ancestor, <a href="/wiki/Salazar_Slytherin" title="Salazar Slytherin">Salazar Slytherin</a>, the magical ability to communicate with <a href="/wiki/Snake" title="Snake">snakes</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-COS_24-8" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-COS-24"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>24<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-HBP_17-25" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HBP-17"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>17<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> It seems that most of his <a href="/wiki/House_of_Gaunt" title="House of Gaunt">Gaunt</a> ancestors (even his <a href="/wiki/Merope_Riddle" title="Merope Riddle">mother</a>, <a href="/wiki/Marvolo_Gaunt" title="Marvolo Gaunt">grandfather</a> and <a href="/wiki/Morfin_Gaunt" title="Morfin Gaunt">uncle</a>) inherited this highly unusual trait; such traits are commonly passed down through families through inbreeding, a practice employed by the Gaunt family.<sup id="cite_ref-HBP_17-26" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HBP-17"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>17<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> This ability was one that he favoured immensely, as he was extremely capable of communicating with the <a href="/wiki/Serpent_of_Slytherin" title="Serpent of Slytherin">Serpent of Slytherin</a><sup id="cite_ref-COS_24-9" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-COS-24"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>24<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> and his loyal pet snake and Horcrux <a href="/wiki/Nagini" title="Nagini">Nagini</a>, commanding them to commit horrific actions in his various diabolical plots.</li></ul>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince">"<i>Thereafter, I am convinced, he intended to continue to rely on his Horcruxes. He would need nothing more, if only he could regain a human form. He was already immortal, you see... or as close to immortal as any man can be.</i>"</span></dd>
<dd>— <a href="/wiki/Albus_Dumbledore" title="Albus Dumbledore">Albus Dumbledore</a> explaining Voldemort's immortality<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Half-Blood_Prince" title="Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince">[src]</a></sup></dd>
<dd></dd></dl></div>
<ul><li><b><a href="/wiki/Immortality" title="Immortality">Immortality</a></b>: Voldemort is the only Dark wizard who was known to have created more than one Horcrux. These Horcruxes were his school diary, the <a href="/wiki/Marvolo_Gaunt%27s_Ring" title="Marvolo Gaunt's Ring">Marvolo Gaunt's Ring</a>, <a href="/wiki/Ravenclaw%27s_Diadem" title="Ravenclaw's Diadem">Ravenclaw's Diadem</a>, <a href="/wiki/Hufflepuff%27s_Cup" title="Hufflepuff's Cup">Hufflepuff's Cup</a>, <a href="/wiki/Slytherin%27s_Locket" title="Slytherin's Locket">Slytherin's Locket</a>, Nagini, and Harry Potter himself. As long as these Horcruxes remained active, Voldemort was immortal and undying, even by a magic as powerful as the Killing Curse.<sup id="cite_ref-HBP_17-27" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HBP-17"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>17<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><b><a href="/wiki/Transfiguration" title="Transfiguration">Transfiguration</a></b>: Voldemort displayed tremendous and near unrivalled skills in Transfiguration. He easily transfigured Dumbledore's fire-rope into a <a href="/wiki/Fire_to_snake_spell" title="Fire to snake spell">black snake</a> during the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_the_Department_of_Mysteries" title="Battle of the Department of Mysteries">Battle of the Department of Mysteries</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-OOTP_31-12" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-OOTP-31"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>31<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> He was also skilful in <a href="/wiki/Conjuration" title="Conjuration">conjuration</a>, as he could craft silver objects of incredible durability, as seen when he produced a <a href="/wiki/Silver_shield_spell" title="Silver shield spell">silver shield</a> strong enough to repel Dumbledore's curse, which was extremely powerful. He could even conjure artificial limbs that possessed far greater strength and immunity to some spells, as he created an <a href="/wiki/Peter_Pettigrew%27s_silver_hand" title="Peter Pettigrew's silver hand">artificial silver forearm and hand</a> for <a href="/wiki/Peter_Pettigrew" title="Peter Pettigrew">Peter Pettigrew</a> <a href="/wiki/Nonverbal_spell" title="Nonverbal spell">non-verbally</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-GOF_33-14" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-GOF-33"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>33<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><b><a href="/wiki/Defence_Against_the_Dark_Arts" title="Defence Against the Dark Arts">Defence Against the Dark Arts</a></b>: As Defence Against the Dark Arts was the subject Voldemort offered to teach when he tried to become a teacher, it can be assumed that despite being far more interested in using dark magic than learning to defend from it, Voldemort had achieved a high score on his O.W.L and N.E.W.T exam and therefore that this was his favourite subject as a student. He was excellently skilled in defending from dark magic in addition to being the most powerful practitioner of the Dark Arts. It can also be assumed that his knowledge of the Dark Arts also made him aware of many advanced defensive spells that few knew of, as he claimed that he could teach students magic they cannot learn from any other should he be the Professor of Defence Against the Dark Arts.</li>
<li><b><a href="/wiki/Spell_creation" title="Spell creation">Spell creation</a></b>: Voldemort was also extremely capable of inventing his own magical <a href="/wiki/Spell" title="Spell">spells</a>, as evidenced with the spell <a href="/wiki/Morsmordre" title="Morsmordre">Morsmordre</a>, which summoned the <a href="/wiki/Dark_Mark" title="Dark Mark">Dark Mark</a> in the sky, being one of Voldemort's own dark inventions. He and his followers used it to summon a floating, green Dark Mark, usually over the houses of their victims.<sup id="cite_ref-GOF_33-15" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-GOF-33"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>33<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Voldemort also invented a spell which allowed a witch or wizard to <a href="/wiki/Unsupported_flight" title="Unsupported flight">fly without support</a>, something long considered a magical impossibility.<sup id="cite_ref-WW-hardest-spells_42-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-WW-hardest-spells-42"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>42<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> He once mentioned to his followers that a few spells of his own invention were used to assist in his rudimentary body.<sup id="cite_ref-GOF33_8-5" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-GOF33-8"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>8<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> It is also likely that some of the dark spells used to hide and protect his Horcruxes were constructed by him as even Dumbledore had difficulty in overcoming them.</li>
<li><b><a href="/wiki/Wandless_magic" title="Wandless magic">Wandless</a> and <a href="/wiki/Nonverbal_spell" title="Nonverbal spell">nonverbal magic</a></b>: Voldemort was also immensely accomplished at both wandless and nonverbal magic, enough so to be capable of using both effortlessly. He could move objects magically without the incantations to do so normally, using his hand to remove the masks from the <a href="/wiki/Death_Eaters" title="Death Eaters">Death Eaters</a> who returned to him after his rebirth while he scolded them and easily lifting the grounded <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter" title="Harry Potter">Harry Potter</a> up by harshly motioning him and later instantly disarming him with a simple wave of his arm during the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_the_Department_of_Mysteries" title="Battle of the Department of Mysteries">Battle of the Department of Mysteries</a>. He was also capable of pushing a dead giant out of his way with a lazy wave of his hand during the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_Hogwarts" title="Battle of Hogwarts">Battle of Hogwarts</a> and also magically moving his cloak to restrain Harry Potter with a mere hand gesture. He was capable of casting spells ranging from simple charms to Dark spells and even the most advanced of magic such as the Unforgivable Curses to their full potency without speaking the incantation.</li>
<li><b><a href="/wiki/Wand" title="Wand">Wand</a> versatility</b>: Voldemort has shown the ability to use wands other than his own with no handicap. He used his uncle Morfin's wand to kill his father and paternal grandparents as a teenager and in 1997, he used <a href="/wiki/Lucius_Malfoy%27s_first_wand" title="Lucius Malfoy's first wand">Lucius Malfoy's wand</a> for a period of time, and could effectively cast a <a href="/wiki/Killing_Curse" title="Killing Curse">Killing Curse</a> on <a href="/wiki/Charity_Burbage" title="Charity Burbage">Charity Burbage</a> with it. Later, during the same year, he intended on using <a href="/wiki/Selwyn" title="Selwyn">Selwyn</a>'s wand, though this did not come to be. In the following year, he took ownership of the <a href="/wiki/Elder_Wand" title="Elder Wand">Elder Wand</a>; despite not unlocking the wand's full power, he was still able to use his usual level of magic (which was described by himself and Snape to be extraordinary), being able to pressure and ultimately defeat three extremely skilled opponents all at once (<a href="/wiki/Minerva_McGonagall" title="Minerva McGonagall">Minerva McGonagall</a>, <a href="/wiki/Horace_Slughorn" title="Horace Slughorn">Horace Slughorn</a> and <a href="/wiki/Kingsley_Shacklebolt" title="Kingsley Shacklebolt">Kingsley Shacklebolt</a>).</li></ul>

<ul><li><b>Intimidation</b>: Lord Voldemort, due to his virtually unequalled capacity for heinous torture and murder, commanded an extremely intimidating presence, enough to frighten low-level thugs and make them work for him out of sheer fear of how he would react to their refusal. Even during his childhood in the orphanage, he was able to incite fear in his fellow orphans and even caretakers, with his unnatural behaviour and powers, which made it very difficult to trace any of his crimes back to him, something that greatly stressed the staff. He was able to swiftly intimidate famed wandmakers <a href="/wiki/Garrick_Ollivander" title="Garrick Ollivander">Garrick Ollivander</a> and <a href="/wiki/Mykew_Gregorovitch" title="Mykew Gregorovitch">Mykew Gregorovitch</a>, both of whom instantly submitted to his malevolent demands, with even the mere sight of him effortlessly terrifying <a href="/wiki/Frank_Bryce" title="Frank Bryce">Frank Bryce</a> and likes of the extremely courageous <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter" title="Harry Potter">Harry Potter</a>, the latter of whom would become haunted by the crimson eyes and cruel gaze of the Dark Lord for three years.  Among the extremely few individuals who did not fear Voldemort included the tremendously fearless <a href="/wiki/Albus_Dumbledore" title="Albus Dumbledore">Albus Dumbledore</a> (who remained staunch in consistently opposing the Dark Lord), the exceptionally brave <a href="/wiki/Sirius_Black" title="Sirius Black">Sirius Black</a> and <a href="/wiki/Remus_Lupin" title="Remus Lupin">Remus Lupin</a> (who were among the extremely few wizards unafraid to call him by name), along with those who defiantly stood up to Voldemort during his reign of terror and died fighting valiantly against him. He also failed to intimidate Gellert Grindelwald, who mocked him to his face and challenged him to kill him. His inner circle of Death Eaters overwhelmingly feared him and consequentially maintained their fierce loyalty to him at least partly out of fear of what he would do to them otherwise. Even the most loyal <a href="/wiki/Bellatrix_Lestrange" title="Bellatrix Lestrange">Bellatrix Lestrange</a>, who has unrequited romantic feelings for Voldemort, would fear him when he was angry. Indeed, Voldemort's profound experience in intimidation tactics allowed him to instil great fear into the hearts of <a href="/wiki/Wizardkind" title="Wizardkind">wizardkind</a>, to the point that almost all feared uttering his name aloud to one another, with <a href="/wiki/Boggart" title="Boggart">Boggarts</a> even commonly appearing as Voldemort since he represented the worst fear of many members of wizardkind.</li>
<li><b>Intellectual genius</b>: Voldemort was not only a great wizard, but also possessed an incredible, genius intellect, as he was considered to be the most brilliant student ever to attend Hogwarts by Dumbledore. His intellect is evidenced by his strategic cunning in being able to mastermind and orchestrate two of the most destructive wars in British wizarding history, with him overwhelming all of the Britain wizarding community and nearly triumphing in both the First and Second Wizarding War. He also proved himself to be a skilled researcher, having successfully discovered his heritage with his middle name, and, by extension, the location of the Chamber of Secrets and his status as the Heir of Slytherin.<sup id="cite_ref-HBP17_25-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HBP17-25"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>25<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Even during his time as a Hogwarts student, Voldemort displayed a capacity to plan far ahead, having meticulously schemed petty crimes and other misdeeds he and his gang carried out throughout their enrolment at the school so the teachers wouldn't be able to find concrete evidence against them, forging false evidence and testimonies to frame others like he did to Hagrid, Morfin, and Hokey; and apparently cursed the post of Defence Against the Dark Arts teacher at Hogwarts so the school wouldn't be able to teach the subject at its fullest thus mitigating the chances of facing opponents who excelled in Defence Against the Dark Arts through enrolling there upon his becoming the Dark Lord.<sup id="cite_ref-COS_24-10" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-COS-24"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>24<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-HBP_17-28" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HBP-17"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>17<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><b>Charisma</b>: Even at a young age, Voldemort displayed remarkable talent for the manipulation of others, being able to manipulate <a href="/wiki/Horace_Slughorn" title="Horace Slughorn">Horace Slughorn</a> into telling him about Horcruxes and gain the trust of every teacher in Hogwarts, with only <a href="/wiki/Albus_Dumbledore" title="Albus Dumbledore">Albus Dumbledore</a> managing to not be swayed by Voldemort's charisma. He also surrounded himself with a group of friends who would become Death Eaters, though Voldemort felt no affection for any of them. He was considered charming by most people who met him, and was able to inspire others to follow him. As an adult, his skills in manipulation grew even further, successfully convincing many wizards and witches to join his cause, although <a href="/wiki/Sirius_Black" title="Sirius Black">Sirius Black</a> noted that Voldemort also used tricks, jinxes, and blackmail to get people to join him. Even when his physical body and magical powers were severely weakened, Voldemort was able to use his charisma to manipulate <a href="/wiki/Quirinus_Quirrell" title="Quirinus Quirrell">Quirinus Quirrell</a> into serving him, when Quirrell originally intended to be the other way around. He also earned the trust of <a href="/wiki/Ginevra_Weasley" title="Ginevra Weasley">Ginny Weasley</a> when she discovered <a href="/wiki/T._M._Riddle%27s_Diary" title="T. M. Riddle's Diary">his diary</a>.</li>
<li><b>Acting skills</b>: Besides his formidable magical skills and extensive knowledge of magic, as a teenager, Tom proved to be a consummate actor, being able to hide his true nature from almost everyone in Hogwarts except Dumbledore. He was able to convince virtually all of the Hogwarts staff and instructors that his facade of being a model student was his true personality and was able to avoid discovery of him having opened the Chamber of Secrets.</li>
<li><b>Leadership skills</b>: Even when he was still only a young student, Riddle was already a very effective leader, as he was able to lead the <a href="/wiki/Tom_Riddle%27s_gang" title="Tom Riddle's gang">forerunners of the Death Eaters</a> to effectively sneak past surveillance, being responsible for several nasty incidences that were never connected to them, showing that even at a young age, Riddle was a very competent leader. As he grew older and gained more experience in leading and thus honed leadership skills further, Tom's style of leadership presumably changed from the original charismatic rule of the Hogwarts gang to the tyrannical and completely ruthless - though no less highly effective - command of his Death Eaters demonstrated throughout both the First and Second Wizarding War. The best example of his efficiency as a leader would be the fact that he, with the help of fewer than forty united Death Eaters, completely overwhelmed and came very close to dominating the entire population of magical Britain during the First Wizarding War and eventually conquered the whole magical Britain during the Second Wizarding War.</li>
<li><b>Salesmanship skills</b>: A largely overlooked talent of Voldemort's was his skills at brokering sales as an assistant at Borgin and Burke's when he was in his late teens. Even Dumbledore was impressed by his skills as a salesman during his time as an employee of Borgin and Burkes. His charisma and knowledge of various magical artefacts helped him in this job and allowed him to acquire a wide variety of magical relics for his employers at the time. This talent and job allowed him to discover the Locket of Slytherin and Helga Hufflepuff's Cup in the possession of Hepizbah Smith. He was often reserved for rather delicate matters that took subtlety and persuasion, but which he also masterfully completed.</li>
<li><b>Teaching skills</b>: When Voldemort attempted to apply for a position as a teacher at Hogwarts, he expressed full confidence in being able to teach the students things they can gain from no other wizards. Despite his ulterior motives that concludes his lack of desire to genuinely pass down knowledge to the next generation, his years of extensive studies and charisma would have certainly made him a successful instructor; something he intended to take advantage of to influence the students and recruit his future army. It can be assumed that had he been allowed to become the Defence Against the Dark Arts Professor, he would have been able to convince many of his students to join his cause and, given that he claimed to be able to teach them magic they cannot learn from others, he would have most likely successfully created a powerful army of wizards and witches. He had proven himself to be a powerful mentor; among his known feats are personally training Bellatrix Lestrange in the Dark Arts, instructing Peter Pettigrew how to brew advanced dark potions, and teaching Severus Snape unsupported flight. In general, the Death Eaters knew how to perform some spells of his own making, mainly the <i>Morsmordre</i> spell. Even Quirinus Quirrell believed that if he sought out Voldemort's remains, he would be able to learn some powerful magic from the Dark Lord.</li>
<li><b>Physical aptitude</b>: Voldemort was in excellent physical condition despite his skeletal physique, with his strength and agility easily overwhelming Harry Potter when he attacked him violently.</li></ul>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Name">Name</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince"><b>Voldemort</b>: "<i>They do not call me 'Tom' any more. These days, I am known as—</i>"</span></dd>
<dd><b>Albus Dumbledore</b>: "<i>I know what you are known as. But to me, I'm afraid, you will always be Tom Riddle. It is one of the irritating things about old teachers. I am afraid that they never quite forget their charges' youthful beginnings.</i>"</dd>
<dd>— <a href="/wiki/Albus_Dumbledore" title="Albus Dumbledore">Albus Dumbledore</a> talking to Voldemort when Voldemort returned to ask for a job at Hogwarts<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Half-Blood_Prince" title="Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince">[src]</a></sup></dd></dl>
</div>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-left show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 250px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/9/9e/I_am_Lord_Voldemort.gif/revision/latest?cb=20190227225113" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="I am Lord Voldemort" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="250" height="101" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="I am Lord Voldemort.gif" data-image-key="I_am_Lord_Voldemort.gif" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/9/9e/I_am_Lord_Voldemort.gif/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20190227225113" /></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/9/9e/I_am_Lord_Voldemort.gif/revision/latest?cb=20190227225113" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="I am Lord Voldemort" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/9/9e/I_am_Lord_Voldemort.gif/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20190227225113" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="250" height="101" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="I am Lord Voldemort.gif" data-image-key="I_am_Lord_Voldemort.gif" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/9/9e/I_am_Lord_Voldemort.gif/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20190227225113" /></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:I_am_Lord_Voldemort.gif" class="info-icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#wds-icons-info-small"></use></svg></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Tom Riddle rearranging the letters of his name</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Voldemort was born Tom Marvolo Riddle, a name he hated due to it being a common name. When he later learned that his father and namesake was a <a href="/wiki/Non-magic_people" title="Non-magic people">Muggle</a>, he decided to forge his own name, 'Voldemort', from an anagram of his full name ('Tom Marvolo Riddle' becomes 'I am Lord Voldemort'). He used his middle name, Marvolo, to track down his magical heritage, due to it being a wizarding name. During this time, Voldemort had adopted the name 'The Heir of Slytherin' after learning about the <a href="/wiki/Chamber_of_Secrets" title="Chamber of Secrets">Chamber of Secrets</a> and his descent from <a href="/wiki/Salazar_Slytherin" title="Salazar Slytherin">Salazar Slytherin</a>. Using this name, he hoped to create a terrifying legacy of his own. Few people ever knew that Voldemort's true name was 'Tom Marvolo Riddle' to begin with.
</p><p>At first, this name was used to refer to him or to address him. Later, he became so feared in the wizarding community that nearly everyone referred to him only as '<i>You-Know-Who</i>', '<i>He-Who-Must-Not-Be-Named</i>', or '<i>The Dark Lord</i>', the last one used primarily by his <a href="/wiki/Death_Eaters" title="Death Eaters">Death Eaters</a> and other supporters. <a href="/wiki/Cornelius_Fudge" title="Cornelius Fudge">Fudge</a> even wrote it to the <a href="/wiki/Prime_Minister" title="Prime Minister">Muggle Prime Minister</a> rather than saying it. According to Death Eaters, not pronouncing his name is a mark of respect. Saying his name to Death Eaters was akin to blasphemy.<sup id="cite_ref-OOTP35_43-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-OOTP35-43"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>43<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> On <i><a href="/wiki/Potterwatch" title="Potterwatch">Potterwatch</a></i>, he was called '<i>Chief Death Eater</i>'. Most people either flinched, screamed or shuddered when they heard the name spoken.
</p><p><a href="/wiki/Albus_Dumbledore" title="Albus Dumbledore">Albus Dumbledore</a> was one of the few who dared refer to him as 'Voldemort', although he preferred to use the name 'Tom', using the former in conversation, and the latter when addressing Voldemort himself, showing his fearlessness. In ignoring the name <i>Voldemort,</i> Dumbledore disallowed him the intimidation he sought while appealing to what little remained of his former student deep within Voldemort. Dumbledore also insists on others to use the name 'Voldemort', rather than 'You-Know-Who', or such varieties, believing that fear in the name would only increase fear of the thing itself.<sup id="cite_ref-PS1_5-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-PS1-5"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>5<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-PS17_44-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-PS17-44"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>44<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Despite this, however, there were those, such as <a href="/wiki/Severus_Snape" title="Severus Snape">Severus Snape</a> and <a href="/wiki/Rubeus_Hagrid" title="Rubeus Hagrid">Rubeus Hagrid</a>, who believed that only Dumbledore was worthy of using the name, and expressed disapproval or even anger when anyone else did so, even <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter" title="Harry Potter">Harry Potter</a>, the one who apparently defeated Voldemort in 1981 and the one <a href="/wiki/Sybill_Trelawney%27s_prophecy_(1980)" title="Sybill Trelawney's prophecy (1980)">prophesised to be the one who can defeat Voldemort for good</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-OOTP24_45-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-OOTP24-45"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>45<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-HBP8_46-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HBP8-46"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>46<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> Much later, Harry, despite never fearing <i>Voldemort</i> in name, would use the name 'Riddle' in their final confrontation, for the same reasons Dumbledore did. The few other known people who were fearlessly willing to use the name Voldemort aloud were <a href="/wiki/Remus_Lupin" title="Remus Lupin">Remus Lupin</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-POA8_47-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-POA8-47"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>47<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> <a href="/wiki/Sirius_Black" title="Sirius Black">Sirius Black</a><sup id="cite_ref-POA18_48-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-POA18-48"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>48<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> and <a href="/wiki/Merula_Snyde" title="Merula Snyde">Merula Snyde</a>. Voldemort would hate it when people dared call him by his forsaken name.
</p><p>After the coup at the Ministry in <a href="/wiki/1997" title="1997">1997</a>, the <a href="/wiki/Taboo" title="Taboo">Taboo</a> was placed on the name 'Voldemort'; speaking the name would summon Death Eaters, <a href="/wiki/British_Ministry_of_Magic" title="British Ministry of Magic">Ministry</a> officials, or <a href="/wiki/Snatchers" title="Snatchers">Snatchers</a> via <a href="/wiki/Apparition" title="Apparition">Apparition</a>. This was used to find those who opposed Voldemort's rule, as only they would dare speak the name. This was how Harry, <a href="/wiki/Ronald_Weasley" title="Ronald Weasley">Ron</a> and <a href="/wiki/Hermione_Granger" title="Hermione Granger">Hermione</a> were found at <a href="/wiki/Tottenham_Court_Road" title="Tottenham Court Road">Tottenham Court Road</a> and before being brought to <a href="/wiki/Malfoy_Manor" title="Malfoy Manor">Malfoy Manor</a>. Also, <a href="/wiki/Kingsley_Shacklebolt" title="Kingsley Shacklebolt">Kingsley Shacklebolt</a> barely escaped Death Eaters when he spoke it.<sup id="cite_ref-DH_27-18" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DH-27"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>27<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p>After Voldemort's demise at the Battle of Hogwarts, it would appear that the wizarding world at large would no longer fear in speaking his name aloud, as <a href="/wiki/Draco_Malfoy" title="Draco Malfoy">Draco Malfoy</a> was one of such people. This could be due to the growth of literature and research about his life and heritage, with one book titled <i><a href="/wiki/Marvolo:_The_Truth" title="Marvolo: The Truth">Marvolo: The Truth</a></i>. One reason why the author gave the book that title was to reveal to the Wizarding public the connection between 'Lord Voldemort' and his undignified grandfather <a href="/wiki/Marvolo_Gaunt" title="Marvolo Gaunt">Marvolo Gaunt</a>, thereby depriving Voldemort of the climate of fear and mystery that he had spent much of his life creating around himself. It could also be that his death was confirmed by thousands of witnesses, unlike his first downfall that only an infant Harry ever witnessed.
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Relationships">Relationships</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Family">Family</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<h4><span id="Parents.2C_grandparents.2C_and_uncle"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="Parents,_grandparents,_and_uncle">Parents, grandparents, and uncle</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h4>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire">"<i>You see that house upon the hillside, Potter? My father lived there. My mother, a witch who lived here in this village, fell in love with him. But he abandoned her when she told him what she was.... He didn't like magic, my father ... He left her and returned to his Muggle parents before I was even born, Potter, and she died giving birth to me, leaving me to be raised in a Muggle orphanage ... but I vowed to find him ... I revenged myself upon him, that fool who gave me his name ... Tom Riddle. ...</i>"</span></dd>
<dd>— Tom Riddle to <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter" title="Harry Potter">Harry Potter</a>, expressing his disdain for the Muggle side of his family<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire" title="Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire">[src]</a></sup></dd>
<dd></dd></dl></div>
<figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 195px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/e/ee/GauntFamily.jpeg/revision/latest?cb=20180101110919" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="GauntFamily" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="195" height="213" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="GauntFamily.jpeg" data-image-key="GauntFamily.jpeg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/e/ee/GauntFamily.jpeg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/195?cb=20180101110919" /></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/e/ee/GauntFamily.jpeg/revision/latest?cb=20180101110919" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="GauntFamily" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/e/ee/GauntFamily.jpeg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/195?cb=20180101110919" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="195" height="213" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="GauntFamily.jpeg" data-image-key="GauntFamily.jpeg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/e/ee/GauntFamily.jpeg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/195?cb=20180101110919" /></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:GauntFamily.jpeg" class="info-icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#wds-icons-info-small"></use></svg></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">The Gaunts Tom's family on his mother's side</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Tom Riddle grew up in a <a href="/wiki/Non-magic_people" title="Non-magic people">Muggle</a> orphanage, not knowing any members of his family. His mother, <a href="/wiki/Merope_Riddle" title="Merope Riddle">Merope Gaunt</a>, died shortly after giving birth, never attempting to save herself through magical or other means. His father's feelings toward him are unknown, as he fled then-pregnant Merope after she stopped drugging him with a <a href="/wiki/Love_potion" title="Love potion">love potion</a>, and didn't track down the whereabouts of their child thereafter. The two met face-to-face in <a href="/wiki/1943" title="1943">1943</a>, when Riddle killed his father and <a href="/wiki/Riddle_family" title="Riddle family">paternal grandparents</a>. Riddle was disgusted by his Muggle relatives, and took on the alias 'Lord Voldemort' partly out of a desire to be rid of his 'filthy Muggle father's name'. Tom Riddle Jnr viewed his father as abandoning his mother for being a witch. Whether this was due to a lack of information or Riddle's prejudice against Muggles is unknown.
</p><p>Despite the maternal side of his family being direct descendants of the great <a href="/wiki/Salazar_Slytherin" title="Salazar Slytherin">Salazar Slytherin</a>, Tom was unimpressed when he found his deranged uncle <a href="/wiki/Morfin_Gaunt" title="Morfin Gaunt">Morfin</a> living in squalor at the <a href="/wiki/Gaunt_Shack" title="Gaunt Shack">Gaunt Shack</a>, and was not above framing Morfin for murder and stealing his <a href="/wiki/Marvolo_Gaunt" title="Marvolo Gaunt">maternal grandfather's</a> prized <a href="/wiki/Marvolo_Gaunt%27s_Ring" title="Marvolo Gaunt's Ring">heirloom ring</a>. Even as a child, he showed contempt for <a href="/wiki/Merope_Riddle" title="Merope Riddle">his mother</a>, and for the weakness of mortality, when he assumed Merope must have been a Muggle if she had been unable to survive. Ironically, it is very possible that Voldemort's more sociopathic and violent tendencies throughout his life could be a result of the 'vein of instability' caused by centuries of <a href="/wiki/Inbreeding" title="Inbreeding">inbreeding</a> due to the Gaunts' narcissistic attitudes towards their Slytherin lineage. Later on in his life, however, Riddle showed visible, if concealed, rage when Hepzibah Smith unknowingly slandered his mother, indicating that his discovery that she was the source of his magical heritage might have led him to caring about Merope's memory at the very least. 
</p><p>Considering Voldemort's loathing towards his heritage and true name, coupled with the rather dysfunctional dynamics of the Gaunt and Riddle families, it raises questions about why Merope chose to name him after his father and maternal grandfather. One possibility is that Merope, even after the abuse she had suffered at the hands of her father and husband, still held enough affection for them to name her only son after them. Alternatively, as Merope was on her deathbed while giving birth to the younger Riddle, she was likely reflecting on her life. Considering her Gaunt childhood of abuse, poverty, and isolation, she likely had very few, if any, friends to socialise with before her marriage to the elder Tom Riddle, leaving Marvolo and Morfin as the only men in her life, and 'Tom' and 'Marvolo' as the few male names that she could think of.
</p><p>Despite Voldemort's detestation and disappointment for his immediate family, he used their residences for his own benefits without such locations being a reminder of how much he hated them, hiding his precious ring Horcrux under the <a href="/wiki/Gaunt_Shack" title="Gaunt Shack">Gaunt Shack</a> and residing in the <a href="/wiki/Riddle_House" title="Riddle House">Riddle House</a> while awaiting his revival ceremony.
</p>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Salazar_Slytherin">Salazar Slytherin</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h4>
<p>The only pride Voldemort ever took on his family was that he inherited the blood of the famous <a href="/wiki/Salazar_Slytherin" title="Salazar Slytherin">Salazar Slytherin</a> from his mother, which he consistently flaunted at every opportunity possible, proudly addressing himself as the 'Heir of Salazar Slytherin', while regarding Slytherin as his 'noble ancestor'.
</p>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Delphini">Delphini</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h4>
<p>It is unknown how Voldemort felt about his daughter <a href="/wiki/Delphini" title="Delphini">Delphini</a> since he died while she was still a baby. However, in the alternative timeline created via a mistake caused by Scorpius and Albus, Voldemort had apparently put Delphini (known as the Augurey) in charge of the Ministry: <a href="/wiki/Dolores_Umbridge" title="Dolores Umbridge">Dolores Umbridge</a> (Headmistress of Hogwarts in this timeline) constantly informs the Augurey with dispatches about everything that is going on in Hogwarts; the Augurey gives instructions to <a href="/wiki/Draco_Malfoy" title="Draco Malfoy">Draco Malfoy</a> (Head of Magical Law Enforcement of the Ministry of Magic in this timeline), e.g. how to deal with incidents involving wizards killing Muggles and bribing the Muggle Prime Minister with gold in such cases. Some students in Hogwarts openly quote the Augurey's motto that 'the future is ours to make', indicating that the Augurey was probably a famous and respected force as well as an inspiring example in the wizarding world of this timeline.  
</p><p>It is therefore likely that had Voldemort lived, he would have considered her an exceptionally faithful servant, something like his right-hand minion or deputy, and given her more power than he usually allowed his Death Eaters. It's notable that in this alternative timeline Delphi has her own official symbol - the bird emblazoned in a fascistic manner - that is widely used in this world, just like the <a href="/wiki/Dark_Mark" title="Dark Mark">Dark Mark</a>, the official symbol of Voldemort. In the office of Head of Magical Law Enforcement in the Ministry there are Augurey flags flying down with this symbol while there are flags with the Dark Mark in Hogwarts. None of the Death Eaters ever had their own individual symbols and none of them ever had individual titles or alias due to having just a collective name for their group, while Delphini was operating under her personal and unique alias 'the Augurey' in this timeline, instead of being known just as another top Death Eater.  
</p><p>It was not known why he wanted a child, as he did not feel a need for love and disliked the idea of becoming emotionally attached to anyone, and in addition desired immortality. However, he likely realised that his daughter could become a talented and useful servant as Bellatrix was. It is also likely that he wished to preserve the Slytherin bloodline, on account of Voldemort being the last remaining heir of Slytherin. He kept her birth a secret, most likely because it may have placed her in danger, since Voldemort was considered the most powerful and dangerous Dark wizard of the time. 
</p><p>Delphini was curious about her parents, and wanted to have the chance to know them. She went to great lengths to meet and save her father, even to the point of meddling with time to create a future where he lived, which shows she had some love for him. After she was defeated by her cousin <a href="/wiki/Draco_Malfoy" title="Draco Malfoy">Draco Malfoy</a>, <a href="/wiki/Hermione_Granger" title="Hermione Granger">Hermione Granger</a>, <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter" title="Harry Potter">Harry Potter</a> and <a href="/wiki/Ronald_Weasley" title="Ronald Weasley">Ron Weasley</a>, she begged for death instead of having to face the fact that she failed her father. 
</p><p>It is rather ironic that Delphini held such strong affection and fascination for her father, a man who felt absolutely no love. The alternative timeline where Voldemort ruled shows that he would have considered Delphini (known as the Augurey in that universe) a faithful servant.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Bellatrix_Lestrange">Bellatrix Lestrange</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire">"<i>The Dark Lord will rise again, <a href="/wiki/Bartemius_Crouch_Senior" title="Bartemius Crouch Senior">Crouch</a>! Throw us into Azkaban, we will wait!</i>"</span></dd>
<dd>— Bellatrix Lestrange proclaiming her loyalty to Voldemort during her trial<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire" title="Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire">[src]</a></sup></dd>
<dd></dd></dl></div>
<figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 175px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/8/80/Bellatrix_Lestrange_promo.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20140622235902" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Bellatrix Lestrange promo" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="175" height="243" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Bellatrix Lestrange promo.jpg" data-image-key="Bellatrix_Lestrange_promo.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/8/80/Bellatrix_Lestrange_promo.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/175?cb=20140622235902" /></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/8/80/Bellatrix_Lestrange_promo.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20140622235902" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Bellatrix Lestrange promo" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/8/80/Bellatrix_Lestrange_promo.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/175?cb=20140622235902" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="175" height="243" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Bellatrix Lestrange promo.jpg" data-image-key="Bellatrix_Lestrange_promo.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/8/80/Bellatrix_Lestrange_promo.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/175?cb=20140622235902" /></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Bellatrix_Lestrange_promo.jpg" class="info-icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#wds-icons-info-small"></use></svg></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption"><a href="/wiki/Bellatrix_Lestrange" title="Bellatrix Lestrange">Bellatrix Lestrange</a>, his best and most loyal servant</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Bellatrix Lestrange was among Voldemort's most loyal and trusted <a href="/wiki/Death_Eaters" title="Death Eaters">Death Eaters</a>. She was entrusted with <a href="/wiki/Hufflepuff%27s_Cup" title="Hufflepuff's Cup">one of his Horcruxes</a>, even though she was kept unaware of what it really was, and stored it in her <a href="/wiki/Gringotts_Wizarding_Bank" title="Gringotts Wizarding Bank">Gringotts</a> <a href="/wiki/Lestrange_Vault" title="Lestrange Vault">vault</a>. She was fanatically loyal to her master as, after his first defeat in <a href="/wiki/1981" title="1981">1981</a>, she did not join many of her fellow Death Eaters in denying their association with him. Instead, she proudly declared that she remained his most loyal servant and that he would surely return. She considered Azkaban a place where she could wait for him, rather than a prison.
</p><p>Her obsession extended to her being in love with and sexually attracted to him. On at least one occasion, during a meeting of his Death Eaters at Malfoy Manor, her face flushed and her eyes welled up with tears when he praised her.
</p><p>He did seem to consider her of greater importance than most of his other servants. He may have had at least a superficial affection for her, as he would call her 'Bella' like other members of her family would. He seemed to be flattered by her unfaltering devotion as he praised her, along with her <a href="/wiki/Rodolphus_Lestrange_(II)" title="Rodolphus Lestrange (II)">husband</a> and <a href="/wiki/Rabastan_Lestrange" title="Rabastan Lestrange">brother-in-law</a> during his rebirth and promised that she would be rewarded; Snape later mentions that despite this he was more impressed by Snape's many years of useful information than Bellatrix's devotion however. At the conclusion of the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_the_Department_of_Mysteries" title="Battle of the Department of Mysteries">Battle of the Department of Mysteries</a>, he grabbed her and Apparated away with her; she was the sole Death Eater who he bothered to help, though this may have been more due to her closer proximity rather than preferential treatment. When she was killed by <a href="/wiki/Molly_Weasley" title="Molly Weasley">Molly Weasley</a> during the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_Hogwarts" title="Battle of Hogwarts">Battle of Hogwarts</a>, he was furious, and intended to avenge her death when Harry intervened.
</p><p>Although Bellatrix was married to one of Voldemort's other loyal Death Eaters, <a href="/wiki/Rodolphus_Lestrange_(II)" title="Rodolphus Lestrange (II)">Rodolphus Lestrange</a>, the union seemed to be nothing more than a business-like partnership. It was Voldemort to whom she spoke in a romantic manner. She was outraged by anyone showing him the slightest disrespect. When <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter" title="Harry Potter">Harry Potter</a> called him by his name in <a href="/wiki/1996" title="1996">1996</a>, she became enraged, due to feeling that he was unworthy of speaking the name.
</p><p>Unknown to nearly all, it would be revealed years later after their death that Bellatrix and Voldemort had in fact engaged in a sexual relationship, resulting in the birth of their daughter <a href="/wiki/Delphini" title="Delphini">Delphini</a> who, years later, threatened to upset the timeline to be with her father. As Voldemort believed that he could cheat death, through his Horcruxes, he probably did not feel a need to leave a child behind as an heir. It is highly likely that he used the relationship with Bellatrix as a way to reward her for her undying loyalty to him, and for her rather potent and notable successes as his most loyal lieutenant. However, a reward appears to be unlikely considering Bellatrix's failures at the Ministry.     
</p><p>Because of his egotistical and self-centred nature, he was likely to have been pleased by Bellatrix's obsessive love for him. Despite believing himself immortal, he may have considered the usefulness of Delphini via the idea of siring a lineage of lieutenants devoutly loyal to him through familial bonds while seeing them as extensions of his own power and authority, much like many kings and tyrants who procreated to expand and solidify their own power through blood ties. He may have also chosen Bellatrix as a mate due to her blood relations and thoroughly proven power as a witch, thus marking her as a potent genetic combination as well as an ideal fit for Voldemort who revelled in his own status and power. A mate of such fortitude and strength would certainly appeal to Voldemort's pathological need to expand his fame and reputation. Voldemort also may have seen Delphini as a way of extending the power of the Slytherin bloodline beyond himself so as to further showcase his as well as his family's might and to further terrorise his enemies with the idea of another Dark Lord ruling alongside him. Voldemort may also have been intellectually enthused or curious at the idea of a student with similar powers and potential as himself, highlighting his vanity and ego even further as he had had no living relatives whose powers he could compare his own to or to have learned from.     
</p><p>It is also possible that the conception of Delphini was unintentional as very little is known about her background.     
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Albus_Dumbledore">Albus Dumbledore</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix">"<i>There is nothing worse than death, Dumbledore!</i>"</span></dd>
<dd>— Voldemort expressing his anger towards Dumbledore<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix" title="Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix">[src]</a></sup></dd>
<dd></dd></dl></div>
<figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/7/75/Albus_Dumbledore_%28HBPF_promo%29.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20150822232849" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Albus Dumbledore (HBPF promo)" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="240" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Albus Dumbledore (HBPF promo).jpg" data-image-key="Albus_Dumbledore_%28HBPF_promo%29.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/7/75/Albus_Dumbledore_%28HBPF_promo%29.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20150822232849" /></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/7/75/Albus_Dumbledore_%28HBPF_promo%29.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20150822232849" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Albus Dumbledore (HBPF promo)" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/7/75/Albus_Dumbledore_%28HBPF_promo%29.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20150822232849" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="240" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Albus Dumbledore (HBPF promo).jpg" data-image-key="Albus_Dumbledore_%28HBPF_promo%29.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/7/75/Albus_Dumbledore_%28HBPF_promo%29.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20150822232849" /></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Albus_Dumbledore_(HBPF_promo).jpg" class="info-icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#wds-icons-info-small"></use></svg></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption"><a href="/wiki/Albus_Dumbledore" title="Albus Dumbledore">Albus Dumbledore</a>, his former teacher and the one wizard Voldemort always feared</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Tom Riddle met Albus Dumbledore at the age of eleven, when the Professor came to invite him to attend <a href="/wiki/Hogwarts_School_of_Witchcraft_and_Wizardry" title="Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry">Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry</a>. Although initially suspicious of Dumbledore, he was at least somewhat impressed by Dumbledore's demonstration of magic. Tom was pleased to discover that he was a wizard, as it confirmed the suspicions he long had about being 'special'. The boy disturbed Dumbledore, however, when he admitted to being able to hurt people who displeased him and being able to <a href="/wiki/Parseltongue" title="Parseltongue">talk to snakes</a>. Even as Tom became an extremely popular student among his peers and Professors at Hogwarts, Dumbledore remained wary of him, and kept a very close watch on him.
</p><p>Riddle (then known as Voldemort) returned to Hogwarts years after graduating to request the <a href="/wiki/Defence_Against_the_Dark_Arts" title="Defence Against the Dark Arts">Defence Against the Dark Arts</a> position from Dumbledore, who had become the school's Headmaster. Suspecting that Voldemort's true intentions were far more sinister than he let on, Dumbledore refused him the position; the result of Dumbledore's refusal was not only that the position of DADA professor became "cursed", but it affirmed Dumbledore's complete refusal to bend to Voldemort's will.
</p>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince"><b>Voldemort</b>: "<i>But nothing I have seen in the world has supported your famous pronouncements that <a href="/wiki/Love" title="Love">love</a> is more powerful than my kind of magic, Dumbledore.</i>"</span></dd>
<dd><b>Albus Dumbledore</b>: "<i>Perhaps you have been looking in the wrong places...,</i>"</dd>
<dd><b>Voldemort</b>: "<i>Well, then, what better place to start my fresh researches than here, at <a href="/wiki/Hogwarts_School_of_Witchcraft_and_Wizardry" title="Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry">Hogwarts</a>? Will you let me return? Will you let me share my knowledge with your students?</i>"</dd>
<dd>— Voldemort to Albus Dumbledore requesting for the Defence Against the Dark Arts post<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Half-Blood_Prince" title="Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince">[src]</a></sup></dd></dl>
</div>
<p>Voldemort despised Dumbledore, not only due to the latter's continued opposition, but also because Dumbledore's belief in the triumphant power of <a href="/wiki/Love" title="Love">love</a> was something that both confused and disgusted Voldemort. Dumbledore was thought to be the only person Voldemort ever feared and one of the few people Voldemort was unable to intimidate, due to Dumbledore being the only wizard whose powers and skill could rival that of Voldemort's. 
</p><p>Dumbledore persisted on referring to him as 'Voldemort' to the public, while still addressing him as 'Tom' in conversation, a subtle but steadfast refusal to allow Voldemort to dictate the terms of their relationship, and a trait that would later be inherited by <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter" title="Harry Potter">Harry Potter</a>. Dumbledore led the efforts against Voldemort in the <a href="/wiki/First_Wizarding_War" title="First Wizarding War">First Wizarding War</a>; over many years, Dumbledore gathered crucial information about Voldemort's past and passed it on to Harry Potter, who would essentially take Dumbledore's place as leader of the opposition in the <a href="/wiki/Second_Wizarding_War" title="Second Wizarding War">Second Wizarding War</a>.
</p><p>In <a href="/wiki/1996" title="1996">1996</a>, Dumbledore and Voldemort met face to face in the <a href="/wiki/British_Ministry_of_Magic" title="British Ministry of Magic">Ministry of Magic</a> during the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_the_Department_of_Mysteries" title="Battle of the Department of Mysteries">Battle of the Department of Mysteries</a>, where Dumbledore addressed Voldemort as 'Tom' and said it was foolish of him to come to the Ministry. Voldemort initiated a fierce <a href="/wiki/Duel_in_the_Ministry_Atrium" title="Duel in the Ministry Atrium">duel</a> with Dumbledore, during which he tried to murder both Dumbledore and Harry, but was unsuccessful; Dumbledore managed to maintain the offensive in the duel, forcing Voldemort to possess Harry so Dumbledore would kill Harry out of a desire to kill him as well. This too was unsuccessful as Harry was able to exorcise the Dark Lord from his body and mind by focussing on his intense feelings of grief over <a href="/wiki/Sirius_Black" title="Sirius Black">Sirius</a>' death. <a href="/wiki/Cornelius_Fudge" title="Cornelius Fudge">Cornelius Fudge</a> arrived at the Ministry just in time to see Voldemort escape with <a href="/wiki/Bellatrix_Lestrange" title="Bellatrix Lestrange">Bellatrix Lestrange</a>, and was finally forced to acknowledge the truth of Voldemort's return.
</p><p>Following his failure to kill either Dumbledore or Harry at the ministry, Voldemort assigned <a href="/wiki/Draco_Malfoy" title="Draco Malfoy">Draco Malfoy</a> to carry out Dumbledore's assassination. Dumbledore became aware of this plot, and addressed it by arranging his own death with <a href="/wiki/Severus_Snape" title="Severus Snape">Severus Snape</a>. At the time of his death in <a href="/wiki/1997" title="1997">1997</a>, Albus Dumbledore had fully equipped Harry Potter with the physical, mental and emotional tools he needed to defeat Voldemort once and for all in <a href="/wiki/1998" title="1998">1998</a>. Later on, during his search for the Elder Wand, Voldemort broke into Dumbledore's tomb.
</p><p>Both Voldemort and Dumbledore shared similar traits; they both wielded extraordinary power that made them among the most powerful wizards in history, although Dumbledore had proven to be, perhaps, his only superior, and understood love, which Voldemort was completely unable to do, both were half-blood, although Voldemort knew nothing about Hogwarts until he was 11. Both were recognised as two of the best wizards to go to Hogwarts and were both <a href="/wiki/Prefect" title="Prefect">Prefects</a> and <a href="/wiki/Head_Boy_or_Girl" title="Head Boy or Girl">Head Boy</a>. Both created and led their own causes (the <a href="/wiki/Order_of_the_Phoenix" title="Order of the Phoenix">Order of the Phoenix</a> and the <a href="/wiki/Death_Eaters" title="Death Eaters">Death Eaters</a>). Both Dumbledore and Voldemort possessed the Elder Wand during their life and both also held trust in Severus Snape.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Harry_Potter">Harry Potter</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows">"<i>I shall attend to the boy in person. There have been too many mistakes where <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter" title="Harry Potter">Harry Potter</a> is concerned, Some of them have been my own. That Potter lives is due more to my errors than to his triumphs. I have been careless, and so have been thwarted by luck and chance, those wreckers of all but the best-laid plans. But I know better now. I understand those things that I did not understand before. I must be the one to kill Harry Potter, and I shall be.</i>"</span></dd>
<dd>— Lord Voldemort announcing his intention to murder Harry<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows" title="Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows">[src]</a></sup></dd>
<dd></dd></dl></div>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-left show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 175px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/c/ce/Harry_Potter_DHF1.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20140603201724" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Harry Potter DHF1" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="175" height="233" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Harry Potter DHF1.jpg" data-image-key="Harry_Potter_DHF1.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/c/ce/Harry_Potter_DHF1.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/175?cb=20140603201724" /></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/c/ce/Harry_Potter_DHF1.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20140603201724" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Harry Potter DHF1" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/c/ce/Harry_Potter_DHF1.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/175?cb=20140603201724" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="175" height="233" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Harry Potter DHF1.jpg" data-image-key="Harry_Potter_DHF1.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/c/ce/Harry_Potter_DHF1.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/175?cb=20140603201724" /></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Harry_Potter_DHF1.jpg" class="info-icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#wds-icons-info-small"></use></svg></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter" title="Harry Potter">Harry Potter</a>, his mortal enemy and unintentional Horcrux</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Harry Potter became Voldemort's mortal enemy after the Dark Lord heard part of a <a href="/wiki/Sybill_Trelawney%27s_prophecy_(1980)" title="Sybill Trelawney's prophecy (1980)">prophecy</a> that foretold the birth of an individual destined to destroy him; two infants met the criteria, but for the simple reason that Harry was a half-blood like himself, Voldemort considered him more of a threat than <a href="/wiki/Neville_Longbottom" title="Neville Longbottom">Neville Longbottom</a>. In targeting Harry, Voldemort unwittingly <i>'marked him as his equal</i>', thus sowing the seeds of his own destruction. Because Harry's <a href="/wiki/Lily_Potter_(I)" title="Lily Potter (I)">mother</a> willingly sacrificed herself for her son, the <a href="/wiki/Killing_Curse" title="Killing Curse">curse</a> backfired. Voldemort lost his physical body, and unintentionally transferred some of his powers and abilities to Harry, while a piece of his soul embedded itself in a <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter%27s_scars#The_lightning-bolt_scar" title="Harry Potter's scars">scar</a> on Harry's forehead, inadvertently making the boy a <a href="/wiki/Horcrux" title="Horcrux">Horcrux</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-DH35_41-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-DH35-41"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>41<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p><p><a href="/wiki/Sybill_Trelawney" title="Sybill Trelawney">Trelawney</a>'s prophecy stated that 'The Chosen One' would have powers the Dark Lord lacked. That power is <a href="/wiki/Love" title="Love">love</a>, and Dumbledore realised that it was Harry's abilities, combined with his capacity to love, that would empower him to defeat Voldemort. Unlike Harry, who was mentally, emotionally, and spiritually intact and whose friends supported him out of loyalty and love (platonic affection), Voldemort was psychologically, spiritually, and emotionally shredded, feeling only arrogance, hate, greed, and jealousy; and he controlled his followers through fear, intimidation and coercion. Harry was disturbed to notice many similarities between them — they were both orphans who thought of <a href="/wiki/Hogwarts_School_of_Witchcraft_and_Wizardry" title="Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry">Hogwarts</a> as their first real homes, and both physically resembled their fathers, and to some degree each other. However, <a href="/wiki/Albus_Dumbledore" title="Albus Dumbledore">Dumbledore</a> insisted that they differed in one absolutely crucial way — Harry had the ability to love, while Voldemort did not.
</p>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix">"<i>I have nothing more to say to you, Potter, You have irked me too often, for too long. AVADA KEDAVRA!</i>"</span></dd>
<dd>— Voldemort attempting to kill Harry Potter during the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_the_Department_of_Mysteries" title="Battle of the Department of Mysteries">Battle of the Department of Mysteries</a><sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix" title="Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix">[src]</a></sup></dd>
<dd></dd></dl></div>
<p>While Harry found it difficult to fathom that something so simple as love is the more powerful force, he understood that, once again, it was also about choices: Voldemort's actions regarding Harry were based on the prophecy, but Harry would choose to fight Voldemort whether or not the prophecy had been made. That choice, and the ability to make that choice, was largely what gave Harry powers that Voldemort lacked and prevented Harry from falling victim to the <a href="/wiki/Dark_Arts" title="Dark Arts">Dark side</a>. Some years earlier, Dumbledore had stressed to Harry that it is one's choices that makes a person what they truly are, just as it had with Harry's father, James, when he chose to overcome his youthful bad behaviour.
</p>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows">"<i>You won't be killing any of them. You won't be killing anyone ever again.</i>"</span></dd>
<dd>— Harry Potter informing Voldemort of his impending doom<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows" title="Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows">[src]</a></sup></dd>
<dd></dd></dl></div><figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 245px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/7/72/Harrypossessed.gif/revision/latest?cb=20141127142301" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Harrypossessed" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="245" height="117" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Harrypossessed.gif" data-image-key="Harrypossessed.gif" data-relevant="0" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/7/72/Harrypossessed.gif/revision/latest?cb=20141127142301" /></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/7/72/Harrypossessed.gif/revision/latest?cb=20141127142301" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Harrypossessed" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/7/72/Harrypossessed.gif/revision/latest?cb=20141127142301" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="245" height="117" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Harrypossessed.gif" data-image-key="Harrypossessed.gif" data-relevant="0" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/7/72/Harrypossessed.gif/revision/latest?cb=20141127142301" /></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Harrypossessed.gif" class="info-icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#wds-icons-info-small"></use></svg></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Voldemort possessing Harry</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Voldemort became obsessed with Harry Potter after he failed to kill the one-year-old boy — livid that a helpless infant caused his downfall. He later sought revenge on Harry to prove that he, Voldemort, was the most feared and powerful wizard of all time. Voldemort's hatred and desire for revenge was strong enough that, when the Horcrux contained in his diary encountered him in the Chamber of Secrets in 1993, he indicated that even the desire to kill Muggle-borns in the name of Salazar Slytherin as his heir no longer mattered to him compared to trying to target Harry for several months since the start of the school year. Voldemort considered Harry weak in comparison to himself and he always discounted how love's power has aided Harry. But after possessing Harry's mind, Harry's overwhelming emotions for his friends and family were so overpowering and disturbing to Voldemort that they drove him out. As a result, he never attempted to possess Harry again.
</p>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows"><b>Voldemort</b>: "<i>Potter doesn't mean that. Who else are you going to use as a shield today, Potter?</i>"</span></dd>
<dd><b>Harry Potter</b>: "<i>No one. There are no more Horcruxes. It's just you and me. One of us is going to leave for good.</i>"</dd>
<dd>— The final confrontation between Voldemort and Harry at the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_Hogwarts" title="Battle of Hogwarts">Battle of Hogwarts</a><sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows" title="Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows">[src]</a></sup></dd></dl>
</div>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-left show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 250px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/6/63/Harry_facing_Voldemort_DHF2.JPG/revision/latest?cb=20151129054544" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Harry facing Voldemort DHF2" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="250" height="108" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Harry facing Voldemort DHF2.JPG" data-image-key="Harry_facing_Voldemort_DHF2.JPG" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/6/63/Harry_facing_Voldemort_DHF2.JPG/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20151129054544" /></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/6/63/Harry_facing_Voldemort_DHF2.JPG/revision/latest?cb=20151129054544" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Harry facing Voldemort DHF2" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/6/63/Harry_facing_Voldemort_DHF2.JPG/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20151129054544" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="250" height="108" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Harry facing Voldemort DHF2.JPG" data-image-key="Harry_facing_Voldemort_DHF2.JPG" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/6/63/Harry_facing_Voldemort_DHF2.JPG/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20151129054544" /></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Harry_facing_Voldemort_DHF2.JPG" class="info-icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#wds-icons-info-small"></use></svg></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Harry and Voldemort before their final duel</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>When the two faced off for the last time, Harry urged Voldemort to feel remorse — the only known means of repairing a fractured soul — but Voldemort reacted with disdain. Harry went on to inform Voldemort that despite wielding the Elder Wand, he was not its master; <a href="/wiki/Draco_Malfoy" title="Draco Malfoy">Draco Malfoy</a> won the wand's allegiance by disarming Dumbledore in the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_the_Astronomy_Tower" title="Battle of the Astronomy Tower">Astronomy Tower</a>, but Harry had disarmed Draco <a href="/wiki/Skirmish_at_Malfoy_Manor" title="Skirmish at Malfoy Manor">months later</a>. Thus, Harry was the true master of the Elder Wand. In his fury, Voldemort made one last attempt at Harry's life, but the <a href="/wiki/Elder_Wand" title="Elder Wand">Elder Wand</a> was loyal to Harry, and the Killing Curse once again backfired on Voldemort. Without his Horcruxes to sustain him, this time the curse finally and completely ended Voldemort's life. Voldemort and Harry were also related by blood, however distantly, through their shared descent from the Peverells (Voldemort through the <a href="/wiki/House_of_Gaunt" title="House of Gaunt">Gaunts</a> and Harry through the <a href="/wiki/Potter_family" title="Potter family">Potters</a>). This made them distant cousins.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Nagini">Nagini</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince">"<i>I think he is perhaps as fond of her as he can be of anything. He certainly likes to keep her close and has an unusual amount of control over her, even for a Parselmouth.</i>"</span></dd>
<dd>— Albus Dumbledore about Voldemort's affection for Nagini<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Half-Blood_Prince" title="Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince">[src]</a></sup></dd>
<dd></dd></dl></div>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-left show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/e/ef/Voldemort_nagini.jpeg/revision/latest?cb=20250501100758" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Voldemort nagini" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="230" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Voldemort nagini.jpeg" data-image-key="Voldemort_nagini.jpeg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/e/ef/Voldemort_nagini.jpeg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20250501100758" /></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/e/ef/Voldemort_nagini.jpeg/revision/latest?cb=20250501100758" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Voldemort nagini" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/e/ef/Voldemort_nagini.jpeg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20250501100758" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="230" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Voldemort nagini.jpeg" data-image-key="Voldemort_nagini.jpeg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/e/ef/Voldemort_nagini.jpeg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20250501100758" /></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Voldemort_nagini.jpeg" class="info-icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#wds-icons-info-small"></use></svg></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Nagini coiled around her master Voldemort</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Voldemort had a special relationship with Nagini, his pet snake who was also one of his <a href="/wiki/Horcrux" title="Horcrux">Horcruxes</a>. Nagini was the only living being that Voldemort seemed to genuinely care about; however, due to the fact that Nagini was one of his Horcruxes, he might have cared about the part of his soul inside her rather than Nagini herself.
