<p>Although Voldemort had lost his physical body, he managed to approach <a href="/wiki/Ginevra_Weasley" title="Ginevra Weasley">Ginny Weasley</a>, a first year <a href="/wiki/Gryffindor" title="Gryffindor">Gryffindor</a> girl and younger sister of <a href="/wiki/Ronald_Weasley" title="Ronald Weasley">Ron Weasley</a> who had a huge crush on <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter" title="Harry Potter">Harry Potter</a>, through one of his <a href="/wiki/Horcrux" title="Horcrux">Horcruxes</a>: <a href="/wiki/T._M._Riddle%27s_Diary" title="T. M. Riddle's Diary">his diary</a>. Tom Riddle's <a href="/wiki/Soul" title="Soul">soul</a> communicated with Ginny through his diary, sympathising with her problems and giving her advice, which made her emotionally vulnerable to Riddle's influence. As this fragment of his soul was preserved as his sixteen year old self, prior to the later disfigurements, Tom Riddle was able to use his earlier good looks to make girls swoon as he had done decades earlier, in this case making an insecure girl feel valued that a tall, dark and handsome man took an interest in her problems. 
</p><p>Eventually, Riddle was able to possess Ginny, use her to open the <a href="/wiki/Chamber_of_Secrets" title="Chamber of Secrets">Chamber of Secrets</a> and free the <a href="/wiki/Serpent_of_Slytherin" title="Serpent of Slytherin">Serpent of Slytherin</a> to <a href="/wiki/Petrification" title="Petrification">petrify</a> several <a href="/wiki/Muggle-born" title="Muggle-born">Muggle-born</a> students (including <a href="/wiki/Hermione_Granger" title="Hermione Granger">Hermione Granger</a>). When Ginny figured out what she had been doing, despite having no memory of what happened during the times she was possessed, she attempted to flush the diary down a toilet; however, as the diary was a Horcrux, it remained undamaged and later ended up in the hands of Harry Potter himself.
</p>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-left show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 245px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/0/00/Ginevra_Weasley_Writing_on_the_Wall.gif/revision/latest?cb=20140407011351" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Ginevra Weasley Writing on the Wall" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="245" height="100" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Ginevra Weasley Writing on the Wall.gif" data-image-key="Ginevra_Weasley_Writing_on_the_Wall.gif" data-relevant="0" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/0/00/Ginevra_Weasley_Writing_on_the_Wall.gif/revision/latest?cb=20140407011351" /></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/0/00/Ginevra_Weasley_Writing_on_the_Wall.gif/revision/latest?cb=20140407011351" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Ginevra Weasley Writing on the Wall" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/0/00/Ginevra_Weasley_Writing_on_the_Wall.gif/revision/latest?cb=20140407011351" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="245" height="100" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Ginevra Weasley Writing on the Wall.gif" data-image-key="Ginevra_Weasley_Writing_on_the_Wall.gif" data-relevant="0" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/0/00/Ginevra_Weasley_Writing_on_the_Wall.gif/revision/latest?cb=20140407011351" /></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Ginevra_Weasley_Writing_on_the_Wall.gif" class="info-icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#wds-icons-info-small"></use></svg></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">A possessed Ginny writing a message on the wall</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Ginny, worried the Diary would reveal to Harry things she'd written about <a href="/wiki/Love" title="Love">her feelings for him</a>, stole the diary back. Riddle possessed Ginny one last time and had her enter the Chamber of Secrets, with every intention of killing her and using her life to restore his own. Harry, however, as a <a href="/wiki/Parseltongue" title="Parseltongue">Parselmouth</a>, was able to enter the Chamber, rescue Ginny, and slay the Basilisk with the <a href="/wiki/Sword_of_Gryffindor" title="Sword of Gryffindor">Sword of Gryffindor</a>. He then used one of the Basilisk's <a href="/wiki/Basilisk_venom" title="Basilisk venom">fangs</a> to stab the Diary, effectively making it the first of Voldemort's Horcruxes to be destroyed.
</p><p>Despite being outwardly sympathetic and understanding, Riddle actually felt great contempt for Ginny, viewing her as '<i>silly</i>' and describing her as '<i>stupid little Ginny</i>'. He considered her '<i>boring</i>' at first, but thought that her diary entries became '<i>far more interesting</i>' after he started possessing her as he apparently found her confusion amusing. Ginny's retrieval of the diary angered Riddle as he had hoped to learn more about Harry Potter. When Voldemort's lieutenant, <a href="/wiki/Bellatrix_Lestrange" title="Bellatrix Lestrange">Bellatrix</a>, was <a href="/wiki/Molly_Weasley%27s_curse" title="Molly Weasley's curse">killed</a> by Ginny's mother <a href="/wiki/Molly_Weasley" title="Molly Weasley">Molly Weasley</a> in retaliation for nearly killing Ginny, Voldemort nearly turned his wand on both mother and daughter. However, this gave Harry the incentive to reveal his being still-alive. Ginny and her surviving relatives all saw Harry <a href="/wiki/Voldemort%27s_Last_Stand" title="Voldemort's Last Stand">defeat</a> Voldemort shortly thereafter. It was unknown to Voldemort that Ginny had won Harry's heart in her fifth year, but he might have suspected it. In addition, Ginny would marry Harry some point after Voldemort's death, making her the Dark Lord's distant cousin-in-law (albeit while Voldemort was dead).
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Rubeus_Hagrid">Rubeus Hagrid</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets">"<i>Monsters don't make good pets, Hagrid.</i>"</span></dd>
<dd>— Riddle before he turned Hagrid in<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Chamber_of_Secrets" title="Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets">[src]</a></sup></dd>
<dd></dd></dl></div>
<figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 180px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/a/a0/Rubeus_Hagrid_promo.png/revision/latest?cb=20161121052620" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Rubeus Hagrid promo" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="225" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Rubeus Hagrid promo.png" data-image-key="Rubeus_Hagrid_promo.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/a/a0/Rubeus_Hagrid_promo.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20161121052620" /></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/a/a0/Rubeus_Hagrid_promo.png/revision/latest?cb=20161121052620" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Rubeus Hagrid promo" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/a/a0/Rubeus_Hagrid_promo.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20161121052620" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="180" height="225" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Rubeus Hagrid promo.png" data-image-key="Rubeus_Hagrid_promo.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/a/a0/Rubeus_Hagrid_promo.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20161121052620" /></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Rubeus_Hagrid_promo.png" class="info-icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#wds-icons-info-small"></use></svg></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption"><a href="/wiki/Rubeus_Hagrid" title="Rubeus Hagrid">Rubeus Hagrid</a>, his determined enemy</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Rubeus Hagrid and Tom Riddle were both students at <a href="/wiki/Hogwarts_School_of_Witchcraft_and_Wizardry" title="Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry">Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry</a> in the <a href="/wiki/1940s" title="1940s">1940s</a>, with Hagrid being three years his junior. In 1943, Riddle opened the <a href="/wiki/Chamber_of_Secrets" title="Chamber of Secrets">Chamber of Secrets</a>, unleashing a <a href="/wiki/Serpent_of_Slytherin" title="Serpent of Slytherin">Basilisk</a> on the school's <a href="/wiki/Muggle-born" title="Muggle-born">Muggle-born</a> students. Most of the students who were attacked ended up <a href="/wiki/Petrification" title="Petrification">petrified</a>, but when the Basilisk finally succeeded in killing <a href="/wiki/Myrtle_Warren" title="Myrtle Warren">one of them</a>, Hogwarts became in danger of closing—a consequence Riddle hadn't foreseen, which would mean him having to return indefinitely to <a href="/wiki/Wool%27s_Orphanage" title="Wool's Orphanage">Wool's Orphanage</a>. Upon realising the school might not have to close if the perpetrator were caught, Riddle stopped attacking students with the Basilisk, closed the Chamber of Secrets, and framed Hagrid, who was known for his love of dangerous <a href="/wiki/Creature" title="Creature">Creatures</a> and at the time was raising <a href="/wiki/Aragog" title="Aragog">Aragog</a>, a young <a href="/wiki/Acromantula" title="Acromantula">Acromantula</a>, for the crime. 
</p><p>Hagrid managed to protect Aragog and even threw Riddle to the ground when he tried to curse him, making Hagrid the only person to challenge Riddle while he was a student. Despite this, Hagrid was expelled from Hogwarts, and the school was allowed to remain open. Believing in Hagrid's innocence, however, Professor <a href="/wiki/Albus_Dumbledore" title="Albus Dumbledore">Albus Dumbledore</a> convinced Headmaster <a href="/wiki/Armando_Dippet" title="Armando Dippet">Armando Dippet</a> to allow Hagrid to stay on at Hogwarts as <a href="/wiki/Hogwarts_gamekeeper" title="Hogwarts gamekeeper">Gamekeeper</a>.
</p><p>Tom Riddle never felt remorse for framing Hagrid and ruining his life. As Riddle went on to become Voldemort, Hagrid joined the <a href="/wiki/Order_of_the_Phoenix" title="Order of the Phoenix">Order of the Phoenix</a> and fought against Lord Voldemort and his <a href="/wiki/Death_Eaters" title="Death Eaters">Death Eaters</a> in the <a href="/wiki/First_Wizarding_War" title="First Wizarding War">First Wizarding War</a>. In <a href="/wiki/1981" title="1981">1981</a>, Hagrid was devastated when Voldemort murdered his friends <a href="/wiki/James_Potter_(I)" title="James Potter (I)">James</a> and <a href="/wiki/Lily_Potter_(I)" title="Lily Potter (I)">Lily Potter</a>, but shared in the relief of the rest of the <a href="/wiki/Wizarding_world" title="Wizarding world">Wizarding world</a> when Voldemort lost his powers and disappeared after failing to kill young <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter" title="Harry Potter">Harry Potter</a>. Although many believed that Voldemort was dead, Hagrid, agreeing with Dumbledore, believed that he would one day return to power. Along with the vast majority of the Wizarding community, Hagrid refused to say Voldemort's name, generally referring to him as 'You-know-who' although he once reluctantly said Voldemort's name when explaining his background to Harry. When Voldemort was searching for the Philosopher's Stone, he took advantage of Hagrid's love and knowledge of magical creatures and through Quirinus Quirrell, gathered the secret of subduing <a href="/wiki/Fluffy" title="Fluffy">Fluffy</a> through music from a drunken Hagrid, who was remorseful afterwards. Since Voldemort had a certain respect for Hogwarts professors, it is not known if that included Hagrid, who taught <a href="/wiki/Care_of_Magical_Creatures" title="Care of Magical Creatures">Care of Magical Creatures</a>. This is unlikely considering Hagrid's half-giant status.
</p><p>In <a href="/wiki/1995" title="1995">1995</a>, after his resurrection, Voldemort dispatched his Death Eaters to convince the <a href="/wiki/Giant" title="Giant">giants</a> to join their side, while Dumbledore had sent Hagrid and <a href="/wiki/Olympe_Maxime" title="Olympe Maxime">Olympe Maxime</a> to do the same. While Hagrid and Maxime were on good terms with the Gurg, <a href="/wiki/Karkus" title="Karkus">Karkus</a>, the Death Eaters supported the giant <a href="/wiki/Golgomath" title="Golgomath">Golgomath</a> in an uprising that resulted in Golgomath beheading Karkus and taking over the giant colony. The giants then attacked Hagrid and Maxime, who were forced to retreat.
</p><p>In <a href="/wiki/1998" title="1998">1998</a>, Hagrid fought in the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_Hogwarts" title="Battle of Hogwarts">Battle of Hogwarts</a> and was captured by the Death Eaters. After Harry sacrificed himself to be killed, Voldemort ordered a grieving Hagrid to carry his friend's 'dead' body in his arms, where it would be clearly visible to Harry's supporters. When Harry finally defeated the Dark Lord, Hagrid was amongst the first few who were able to congratulate him on his triumph.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Quirinus_Quirrell">Quirinus Quirrell</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire">"<i>Then ... four years ago ... the means for my return seemed assured. A wizard - young, foolish, and gullible - wandered across my path in the forest I had made my home. Oh, he seemed the very chance I had been dreaming of... for he was a teacher at Dumbledore's school... he was easy to bend to my will... he brought me back to this country, and after a while, I took possession of his body, to supervise him closely as he carried out my orders. But my plan failed. I did not manage to steal the Philosopher's Stone. I was not to be assured immortal life. I was thwarted ... thwarted, once again, by Harry Potter. ...</i>"</span></dd>
<dd>— Voldemort's control and possession of Quirrell<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire" title="Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire">[src]</a></sup></dd>
<dd></dd></dl></div>
<figure class="thumb mw-halign-left show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 175px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/d/d2/Quirinus_Quirrell_PS_promo.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20110806132643" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Quirinus Quirrell PS promo" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="175" height="233" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Quirinus Quirrell PS promo.jpg" data-image-key="Quirinus_Quirrell_PS_promo.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/d/d2/Quirinus_Quirrell_PS_promo.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/175?cb=20110806132643" /></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/d/d2/Quirinus_Quirrell_PS_promo.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20110806132643" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Quirinus Quirrell PS promo" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/d/d2/Quirinus_Quirrell_PS_promo.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/175?cb=20110806132643" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="175" height="233" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Quirinus Quirrell PS promo.jpg" data-image-key="Quirinus_Quirrell_PS_promo.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/d/d2/Quirinus_Quirrell_PS_promo.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/175?cb=20110806132643" /></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Quirinus_Quirrell_PS_promo.jpg" class="info-icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#wds-icons-info-small"></use></svg></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption"><a href="/wiki/Quirinus_Quirrell" title="Quirinus Quirrell">Quirinus Quirrell</a>, his loyal servant</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Quirinus Quirrell encountered Lord Voldemort's disembodied soul fragment in the <a href="/wiki/Albania" title="Albania">Black Forest of Albania</a>, during his world travels. Originally naively trying to capture the Dark Lord's remains, Quirrell overestimated himself thinking he could subjugate Voldemort and learn powerful magic from him. With promises of wealth, domination and possibly immortality, Voldemort convinced Quirrell to become his faithful servant, and even to share his body. Quirrell followed orders with a tint of fear, and at times tried, feebly and futilely, to resist the possession.
</p><p>On Voldemort's orders, Quirrell returned to <a href="/wiki/London" title="London">London</a> in <a href="/wiki/1991" title="1991">1991</a> and <a href="/wiki/Break-in_of_Gringotts_Wizarding_Bank_(1991)" title="Break-in of Gringotts Wizarding Bank (1991)">broke into</a> <a href="/wiki/Vault_713" title="Vault 713">Vault 713</a> at <a href="/wiki/Gringotts_Wizarding_Bank" title="Gringotts Wizarding Bank">Gringotts Wizarding Bank</a> to procure the <a href="/wiki/Philosopher%27s_Stone" title="Philosopher's Stone">Philosopher's Stone</a>, only to find that it had been emptied earlier that day and the Stone transferred to <a href="/wiki/Hogwarts_School_of_Witchcraft_and_Wizardry" title="Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry">Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry</a> by <a href="/wiki/Rubeus_Hagrid" title="Rubeus Hagrid">Rubeus Hagrid</a>.
</p><p>Quirrell took the position of <a href="/wiki/Professor" title="Professor">Professor</a> of <a href="/wiki/Defence_Against_the_Dark_Arts" title="Defence Against the Dark Arts">Defence Against the Dark Arts</a> at Hogwarts, with the aim of tracking down the Stone. When he and Voldemort realised <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter" title="Harry Potter">Harry Potter</a> was starting at Hogwarts that same year, Quirrell attempted to kill Harry, but was prevented from doing so first by <a href="/wiki/Severus_Snape" title="Severus Snape">Severus Snape</a>, then, unwittingly, by <a href="/wiki/Hermione_Granger" title="Hermione Granger">Hermione Granger</a>.
</p>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone"><b>Voldemort</b>: "<i>Seize him! SEIZE HIM!</i>"</span></dd>
<dd><b>Quirrell</b>: "<i>Master, I cannot hold him -- my hands -- my hands!</i>"</dd>
<dd><b>Voldemort</b>: "<i>Then kill him, fool, and be done!</i>"</dd>
<dd>— Voldemort furiously demanding Quirrell kill Harry<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Philosopher%27s_Stone" title="Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone">[src]</a></sup></dd></dl>
</div>
<p>Quirrell once again turned his attention to finding the Philosopher's Stone, and overcame several enchanted obstacles to travel through the <a href="/wiki/Underground_Chambers#Sixth" title="Underground Chambers">Philosopher's Stone Chambers</a>. Harry followed Quirrell through the Chambers, believing he was actually following Severus Snape, and eventually found Quirrell attempting to retrieve the Stone from the <a href="/wiki/Mirror_of_Erised" title="Mirror of Erised">Mirror of Erised</a> in the final chamber. Voldemort ordered Quirrell to use Harry to get the stone, and when the Stone appeared in Harry's pocket, Harry attempted to conceal the fact by lying about what he saw in the Mirror. Voldemort, seeing through Harry's lie, offered Harry power and glory, and even the possibility of seeing his parents again, in exchange for joining him and handing over the stone. Upon Harry's refusal, Voldemort ordered Quirrell to take the Stone by force, but found that Quirrell was unable to touch the boy without enduring excruciating pain as a result of the protection afforded to Harry by his mother's loving <a href="/wiki/Sacrificial_protection" title="Sacrificial protection">sacrifice</a>. To escape the pain, Voldemort separated his soul from Quirrell's body and fled, leaving Quirrell to die; Dumbledore noted that this was an act of Voldemort's mercilessness on his subordinates as much as towards his enemies.
</p><p>Three years after abandoning Quirrell to his demise, Voldemort expressed to his <a href="/wiki/Death_Eaters" title="Death Eaters">Death Eaters</a> that he saw Quirrell as a foolish and gullible man whose only value was his position at Hogwarts.
</p>
<h3><span id="Wool.27s_Orphanage_residents"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="Wool's_Orphanage_residents">Wool's Orphanage residents</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince">"<i>I can make things move without touching them. I can make animals do what I want them to do, without training them. I can make bad things happen to people who annoy me. I can make them hurt if I want to. I knew I was different. I knew I was special. Always, I knew there was something.</i>"</span></dd>
<dd>— A young Riddle explaining his difference and distance from, and disdain for the other Orphanage residents<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Half-Blood_Prince" title="Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince">[src]</a></sup></dd>
<dd></dd></dl></div>
<p>Tom Riddle grew up at the <a href="/wiki/Non-magic_people" title="Non-magic people">Muggle</a> <a href="/wiki/Wool%27s_Orphanage" title="Wool's Orphanage">orphanage</a> where his <a href="/wiki/Merope_Riddle" title="Merope Riddle">mother</a> brought him shortly before her death in <a href="/wiki/1926" title="1926">1926</a>.
</p><p>Tom's relationship with the other residents of the orphanage was strained, to say the least. Some of the orphanage's staff, such as Mrs Cole, believed that his mother had originated from a circus due to his middle name. Tom was never given sufficient attention from the staff due to his independent nature nurtured by a lack of parental love, as he rarely cried as an infant, and his peculiar nature distanced him from the others. When <a href="/wiki/Albus_Dumbledore" title="Albus Dumbledore">Albus Dumbledore</a>, then professor at <a href="/wiki/Hogwarts_School_of_Witchcraft_and_Wizardry" title="Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry">Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry</a>, arrived at the orphanage to invite Tom to attend Hogwarts, Tom initially believed that <a href="/wiki/Cole" title="Cole">Mrs Cole</a>, the orphanage's matron, had called Dumbledore to take him to an asylum; Tom defensively insulted Cole for the one being insane and should be sent to an asylum instead. 
</p><p>Dumbledore discovered that Tom had been bullying the other children, namely <a href="/wiki/Amy_Benson" title="Amy Benson">Amy Benson</a> and <a href="/wiki/Dennis_Bishop" title="Dennis Bishop">Dennis Bishop</a>, and that he had a habit of keeping trophies to signify the terror he was able to cause. He knew he was different from the other children; he was intelligent and far more powerful than his peers, and had no issue with punishing those who did not do as he told them. When Dumbledore assured him that he wasn't from an asylum, and that Tom was, in fact, a <a href="/wiki/Wizardkind" title="Wizardkind">wizard</a>, Riddle was unusually quick to believe him, having always considered himself 'special'.
</p><p>Riddle hated the orphanage, which was a reminder of the poor and common start to his life; ultimately, he thought of Hogwarts as his first and real home. He would dread returning to the facility during the <a href="/wiki/Summer_holidays" title="Summer holidays">summer holidays</a>, even requesting then-<a href="/wiki/Headteacher" title="Headteacher">Headmaster</a> <a href="/wiki/Armando_Dippet" title="Armando Dippet">Dippet</a> to let him remain in school instead. Contrarily to his charismatic behaviour at Hogwarts, Riddle never attempted to charm any of the orphans nor caretakers in the facility, barely hiding his contempt for the muggles he was forced to live with as opposed to his magical contemporaries. Upon graduating, Riddle departed from the orphanage for good, distancing himself from it by immersing in the path of dark magic, and refused to use it as a hiding place for one of his <a href="/wiki/Horcrux" title="Horcrux">Horcruxes</a>.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Hepzibah_Smith">Hepzibah Smith</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince">"<i>You naughty boy, you shouldn't have! You do spoil this old lady, Tom.</i>"</span></dd>
<dd>— Hepzibah Smith, in response to Riddle bringing her flowers on the day she showed him <a href="/wiki/Slytherin%27s_Locket" title="Slytherin's Locket">The Locket of Slytherin</a> and <a href="/wiki/Hufflepuff%27s_Cup" title="Hufflepuff's Cup">The Cup of Hufflepuff</a><sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Half-Blood_Prince" title="Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince">[src]</a></sup></dd>
<dd></dd></dl></div>
<figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 195px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/5/5e/HepzibahSmith.png/revision/latest?cb=20140401181824" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="HepzibahSmith" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="195" height="194" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="HepzibahSmith.png" data-image-key="HepzibahSmith.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/5/5e/HepzibahSmith.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/195?cb=20140401181824" /></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/5/5e/HepzibahSmith.png/revision/latest?cb=20140401181824" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="HepzibahSmith" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/5/5e/HepzibahSmith.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/195?cb=20140401181824" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="195" height="194" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="HepzibahSmith.png" data-image-key="HepzibahSmith.png" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/5/5e/HepzibahSmith.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/195?cb=20140401181824" /></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:HepzibahSmith.png" class="info-icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#wds-icons-info-small"></use></svg></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Hepzibah Smith, one of his many murder victims</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>Tom Riddle first met <a href="/wiki/Hepzibah_Smith" title="Hepzibah Smith">Hepzibah Smith</a> when he worked at <a href="/wiki/Borgin_and_Burkes" title="Borgin and Burkes">Borgin and Burkes</a>. As a polite, handsome, and clever young man with a great capacity to charm and a powerful gift of persuasion, he became friendly with Hepzibah, flattering her and making her feel pretty. He convinced her to show him two of her greatest treasures—<a href="/wiki/Slytherin%27s_Locket" title="Slytherin's Locket">Salazar Slytherin's Locket</a> and <a href="/wiki/Hufflepuff%27s_Cup" title="Hufflepuff's Cup">Helga Hufflepuff's Cup</a>—which he planned to steal and turn into <a href="/wiki/Horcrux" title="Horcrux">Horcruxes</a>. He killed Hepzibah two days later by mixing a lethal and little-known poison into her cocoa, and took the two artefacts. 
</p><p>He was never suspected in her murder, as he framed Smith's house-elf, <a href="/wiki/Hokey" title="Hokey">Hokey</a>, by modifying the elf's memory. Prior to her death, Hepzibah realised too late of Tom's greed for the treasures, which led her affections to falter somewhat. Riddle was remorseless for his role in Smith's death, and even used it to turn the Cup into a Horcrux.<sup id="cite_ref-HBP20_4-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HBP20-4"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>4<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Gellert_Grindelwald">Gellert Grindelwald</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<div class="quote">
<dl><dd><span title="Source: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows">"<i>Kill me, then, Voldemort, I welcome death! But my death will not bring you what you seek ... there is so much you do not understand ...</i>"</span></dd>
<dd>— Grindelwald to Voldemort, shortly before Voldemort killed him<sup class="noprint"><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows" title="Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows">[src]</a></sup></dd>
<dd></dd></dl></div>

<p>It is unknown if Voldemort and Grindelwald had ever met each other prior to 1998. It is unknown what Voldemort's personal views on Grindelwald's atrocities towards Muggles were or his attempted revolution to subjugate them though it is likely he did not care and took no inspiration from Grindelwald for his own attempted conquests later on. Despite Grindelwald's status as one of the most powerful Dark wizards to have ever existed, inferior only to Voldemort himself, he seemed to have no praise or respect for the elder Dark wizard and treated him as merely another person to interrogate in his search for the Elder Wand.
</p>
<figure class="thumb  show-info-icon" typeof="mw:File/Thumb" style="width: 250px"> 	<a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/1/1b/Voldemort_and_Grindelwald_DHF1.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20190817172422" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Voldemort and Grindelwald DHF1" src="data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="250" height="103" class="thumbimage lazyload" data-image-name="Voldemort and Grindelwald DHF1.jpg" data-image-key="Voldemort_and_Grindelwald_DHF1.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/1/1b/Voldemort_and_Grindelwald_DHF1.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20190817172422" /></a> 	<noscript><a href="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/1/1b/Voldemort_and_Grindelwald_DHF1.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20190817172422" class="mw-file-description image"><img alt="Voldemort and Grindelwald DHF1" src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/1/1b/Voldemort_and_Grindelwald_DHF1.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20190817172422" decoding="async" loading="lazy" width="250" height="103" class="thumbimage" data-image-name="Voldemort and Grindelwald DHF1.jpg" data-image-key="Voldemort_and_Grindelwald_DHF1.jpg" data-relevant="1" data-src="https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/harrypotter/images/1/1b/Voldemort_and_Grindelwald_DHF1.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20190817172422" /></a></noscript> 	<figcaption class="thumbcaption"> 		 			<a href="/wiki/File:Voldemort_and_Grindelwald_DHF1.jpg" class="info-icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#wds-icons-info-small"></use></svg></a> 		 		 		 			<p class="caption">Grindelwald speaking to Voldemort in Nurmengard, seconds before his death</p> 		 	</figcaption> </figure>
<p>By the time Voldemort visited Grindelwald in his Nurmengard prison in 1998, Grindelwald seemed to know all about him, and claimed that he knew that Voldemort would one day visit him to seek out the Elder Wand. Despite being trapped and completely defenceless against one of the few wizards more powerful than himself, Grindelwald showed no fear towards the Dark Lord, and he laughed, scornfully challenging Voldemort to kill him, using the younger wizard's chosen name in contempt of his great power, much to the latter's fury. 
</p><p>Grindelwald refused to tell Voldemort the Elder Wand's location and taunted him by telling him that he would never be able to master the wand. Furious at his inability to gain information from the former master of the Elder Wand, Voldemort's fury eventually broke, and he murdered Grindelwald with the Killing Curse. 
Ultimately, Grindelwald's prediction of Voldemort never fully mastering the Elder Wand would become reality, and would cause Voldemort's own demise during his final duel with <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter" title="Harry Potter">Harry Potter</a>.
</p>

<p>The Order of the Phoenix was a secret organisation founded and led by <a href="/wiki/Albus_Dumbledore" title="Albus Dumbledore">Albus Dumbledore</a> to oppose Voldemort and his <a href="/wiki/Death_Eaters" title="Death Eaters">Death Eaters</a>.
</p><p>Though it was unknown to Voldemort till shortly before his defeat, <a href="/wiki/Severus_Snape" title="Severus Snape">Severus Snape</a> was a member of the Order who had defected from the Death Eaters and worked for Dumbledore as a spy shortly after Voldemort began hunting <a href="/wiki/Lily_Potter_(I)" title="Lily Potter (I)">Lily Potter</a>.
</p><p><a href="/wiki/James_Potter_(I)" title="James Potter (I)">James</a> and <a href="/wiki/Lily_Potter_(I)" title="Lily Potter (I)">Lily Potter</a> were members of the Order who became prime targets for Voldemort during the <a href="/wiki/First_Wizarding_War" title="First Wizarding War">First Wizarding War</a>, after Voldemort heard of a prophecy foretelling of a child destined to destroy him. This fit the description of their young son, <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter" title="Harry Potter">Harry</a>. On <a href="/wiki/31_October" title="31 October">31 October</a> <a href="/wiki/1981" title="1981">1981</a>, Voldemort found the Potters after the <a href="/wiki/Fidelius_Charm" title="Fidelius Charm">Fidelius Charm</a> they had cast was broken by <a href="/wiki/Peter_Pettigrew" title="Peter Pettigrew">Peter Pettigrew</a>. Voldemort killed an unarmed James mercilessly first and ordered Lily to stand aside (since Severus Snape had requested him to spare her), so he could kill Harry. When Lily refused to stand aside, Voldemort killed her as well, making her murder a <a href="/wiki/Sacrificial_protection" title="Sacrificial protection">sacrifice</a> that caused the Killing Curse Voldemort aimed at Harry to backfire; Voldemort lost his body and fled to <a href="/wiki/Albania" title="Albania">Albania</a>.
</p><p>Shortly after Voldemort lost his powers in 1981, the <a href="/wiki/Longbottom_family" title="Longbottom family">Longbottom family</a> suffered at the hands of <a href="/wiki/Bellatrix_Lestrange" title="Bellatrix Lestrange">Bellatrix Lestrange</a>, her husband <a href="/wiki/Rodolphus_Lestrange_(II)" title="Rodolphus Lestrange (II)">Rodolphus</a>, her brother-in-law <a href="/wiki/Rabastan_Lestrange" title="Rabastan Lestrange">Rabastan</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Bartemius_Crouch_Junior" title="Bartemius Crouch Junior">Barty Crouch Jnr</a>, who tortured <a href="/wiki/Alice_Longbottom" title="Alice Longbottom">Alice</a> and <a href="/wiki/Frank_Longbottom" title="Frank Longbottom">Frank Longbottom</a>, new parents to <a href="/wiki/Neville_Longbottom" title="Neville Longbottom">Neville Longbottom</a>, to the point of insanity. They became permanent residents of <a href="/wiki/St_Mungo%27s_Hospital_for_Magical_Maladies_and_Injuries" title="St Mungo's Hospital for Magical Maladies and Injuries">St Mungo's Hospital for Magical Maladies and Injuries</a>, and Neville was left to be raised by his grandmother, <a href="/wiki/Augusta_Longbottom" title="Augusta Longbottom">Augusta Longbottom</a>. During the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_Hogwarts" title="Battle of Hogwarts">Battle of Hogwarts</a> in <a href="/wiki/1998" title="1998">1998</a>, Neville openly defied Voldemort and was tortured. However, he survived, and destroyed Voldemort's last remaining <a href="/wiki/Horcrux" title="Horcrux">Horcrux</a> when he beheaded <a href="/wiki/Nagini" title="Nagini">Nagini</a> using the <a href="/wiki/Sword_of_Gryffindor" title="Sword of Gryffindor">Sword of Gryffindor</a>.
</p><p><a href="/wiki/Alastor_Moody" title="Alastor Moody">Alastor 'Mad-Eye' Moody</a> was a highly skilled <a href="/wiki/Auror" title="Auror">Auror</a> and active member of the Order who fought against Voldemort during the <a href="/wiki/First_Wizarding_War" title="First Wizarding War">First Wizarding War</a>. After Voldemort's first downfall in 1981, Moody was responsible for rounding up a number of Death Eaters, such as <a href="/wiki/Igor_Karkaroff" title="Igor Karkaroff">Igor Karkaroff</a>, and killing several others, like <a href="/wiki/Evan_Rosier" title="Evan Rosier">Evan Rosier</a>. In <a href="/wiki/1994" title="1994">1994</a>, Voldemort ordered <a href="/wiki/Bartemius_Crouch_Junior" title="Bartemius Crouch Junior">Barty Crouch Jnr</a> to kidnap Moody and imprison him in his own <a href="/wiki/Moody%27s_Trunk" title="Moody's Trunk">trunk</a>. For the next nine months, Crouch used Moody's hair to brew the <a href="/wiki/Polyjuice_Potion" title="Polyjuice Potion">Polyjuice Potion</a> that would allow him to take Moody's place as temporary professor of <a href="/wiki/Defence_Against_the_Dark_Arts" title="Defence Against the Dark Arts">Defence Against the Dark Arts</a> at <a href="/wiki/Hogwarts_School_of_Witchcraft_and_Wizardry" title="Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry">Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry</a>. In <a href="/wiki/1995" title="1995">1995</a>, Crouch used his position at Hogwarts to make sure <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter" title="Harry Potter">Harry Potter</a> was transported to the <a href="/wiki/Little_Hangleton_graveyard" title="Little Hangleton graveyard">Little Hangleton graveyard</a>, where <a href="/wiki/Peter_Pettigrew" title="Peter Pettigrew">Peter Pettigrew</a> used Harry's blood in a <a href="/wiki/Regeneration_potion" title="Regeneration potion">potion</a> that allowed Voldemort to be restored to his body. 
</p><p>When Voldemort failed to kill Harry in the graveyard and Harry returned to Hogwarts, Barty Crouch Jnr attempted to murder him personally. Dumbledore, <a href="/wiki/Minerva_McGonagall" title="Minerva McGonagall">Minerva McGonagall</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Severus_Snape" title="Severus Snape">Severus Snape</a> rescued Harry, after which Crouch was exposed, and Moody was freed. After Dumbledore's death in <a href="/wiki/1997" title="1997">1997</a>, Moody took charge of the Order of the Phoenix, until he was murdered by Voldemort during the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_the_Seven_Potters" title="Battle of the Seven Potters">Battle of the Seven Potters</a>. Notably Voldemort seemed to acknowledge Moody's skills as a wizard as he targeted him personally as the most likely person to be guarding the real Harry.
</p><p>Nearly all of the <a href="/wiki/Weasley_family" title="Weasley family">Weasley family</a> were active within the Order of the Phoenix. They fought against Voldemort during both the First and Second Wizarding wars. They lost family members such as <a href="/wiki/Fabian_Prewett" title="Fabian Prewett">Fabian</a> and <a href="/wiki/Gideon_Prewett" title="Gideon Prewett">Gideon Prewett</a>, brothers of <a href="/wiki/Molly_Weasley" title="Molly Weasley">Molly Weasley</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Fred_Weasley" title="Fred Weasley">Fred Weasley</a>, who was killed in the Battle of Hogwarts. Voldemort had previously tried to manipulate <a href="/wiki/Ginevra_Weasley" title="Ginevra Weasley">Ginny Weasley</a> in <a href="/wiki/1992" title="1992">1992</a>, in an attempt to return to physical form, through one of his <a href="/wiki/T._M._Riddle%27s_Diary" title="T. M. Riddle's Diary">Horcruxes</a>. Voldemort was furious when Molly defeated Bellatrix, and would have killed her, had Harry not intervened. Most of the Weasley family watched the final duel between Voldemort and Harry, and were witnesses to Voldemort's death.
</p><p><a href="/wiki/Dorcas_Meadowes" title="Dorcas Meadowes">Dorcas Meadowes</a>, <a href="/wiki/Caradoc_Dearborn" title="Caradoc Dearborn">Caradoc Dearborn</a>, the <a href="/wiki/Bones_family" title="Bones family">Bones family</a>, the <a href="/wiki/McKinnon_family" title="McKinnon family">McKinnon family</a>, <a href="/wiki/Benjy_Fenwick" title="Benjy Fenwick">Benjy Fenwick</a> and <a href="/wiki/Emmeline_Vance" title="Emmeline Vance">Emmeline Vance</a> were all Order members killed either by Voldemort himself or by his <a href="/wiki/Death_Eaters" title="Death Eaters">Death Eaters</a> during the <a href="/wiki/First_Wizarding_War" title="First Wizarding War">First</a> and <a href="/wiki/Second_Wizarding_War" title="Second Wizarding War">Second Wizarding Wars</a>.
</p>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Etymology">Etymology</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Lord_Voldemort">Lord Voldemort</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<ul><li>Although <a href="/wiki/J._K._Rowling" title="J. K. Rowling">J. K. Rowling</a> has never quite explained the origins of the name 'Voldemort', there are some possible theories. 'Mors', or 'mortum' is the Latin word for death (which has evolved in many Romance languages as '<i>muerte</i>' or '<i>morte</i>', and the English word 'murder' indeed has its origins in the same root word as 'mors'). Therefore, while not necessarily true, the possible meaning of the word 'Voldemort' may be either 'representative of death' or 'ambassador of death'. Yet, the most accurate etymology of Voldemort would be the French sentence 'Vol de mort' which literally means 'flight of death' (accurate considering the murder sprees he committed and <a href="/wiki/Unsupported_flight" title="Unsupported flight">his invention of a spell to achieve unsupported flight</a>). It is quite plausible this is the real etymology of his name as J. K. Rowling herself speaks French and had taught it once. 'Vol de mort' can also literally mean 'Theft of death' in French which can also be accurate since Lord Voldemort's search for immortality (which would mean he would have to steal his life from death). The Catalan expression 'vol de mort', also means 'flight of death' or, since 'Vol' may also be from the Latin root 'volo' ('I will, wish, want'), may mean 'death wish'.</li>
<li>J. K. Rowling has said in an interview that the T in Voldemort is silent.<sup id="cite_ref-ReferenceA_49-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-ReferenceA-49"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>49<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> This may be due to the fact that the French word <b>mort</b>, meaning death, has a silent T. The silent T was maintained in the earlier editions of the audio book releases of the novels, but was discontinued in those releases following the release of the films, in which the T was used out loud. In 2015, Rowling again confirmed in an interview that her preferred pronunciation of the name was with a silent 'T', though she noted '...but I'm pretty sure I'm the only person who pronounces it that way'.<sup id="cite_ref-twittersilent_50-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-twittersilent-50"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>50<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li></ul>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Tom_Marvolo_Riddle">Tom Marvolo Riddle</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<ul><li><b>Tom</b> is <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/diminutive" class="extiw" title="wikipedia:diminutive">diminutive</a> of Thomas Θωμᾶς, loaned from Aramaic תאומא taʔuma, meaning 'twin'; cognate with Hebrew תאום  təʔōm.<sup id="cite_ref-51" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-51"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>51<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> This choice can be explained by the fact that, to gain immortality, Tom Riddle divided, twinned in a way, his soul into different pieces so as to survive. Also, τόμος (tomos) is Ancient Greek for 'slice' or 'piece', which could link his name to the Horcruxes. A further evidence for that connection is Rowling's comparison of the making of a Horcrux to the splitting of the atom in terms of significance. The word 'atom' is derived from the same Ancient Greek word with an added negative prefix, ἄτομος ‎(átomos), meaning inseparable.</li>
<li>His maternal grandfather's name <b>Marvolo </b>suggests <i>marvelous</i>, from Latin <i>mirabilis</i>: consisting of from <i>mirari</i> 'to wonder at', from root adjective <i>mirus</i> 'wonderful' and suffix <i>-bilis</i>, denoting capacity. The name also contains the Latin root <i>volo</i> meaning 'I wish, want, will, ordain, suppose, maintain that, be willing, to mean, signify, or denote'. Another homophone, <i>volo</i> also means 'I fly, speed, or move rapidly'. Marvolo Gaunt & his grandson Tom can be seen as characters who want to achieve greatness very quickly. It could also derive from Shakespeare's Twelfth Night character Malvolio (a punningly humorous name meaning roughly 'I wish wickedly' or simply 'ill-willing'). He is a Puritan who could not have fun and sought to stop the other servants from enjoying themselves. He is 'sick with self love' and dreams of gaining domination. He thinks he is better than the others because he believes he is 'pure'. He is constantly the subject of practical jokes. The quote 'Some are born great, some achieve greatness, and some have greatness thrust upon them' comes from here. At the end of the play, he swears revenge on the lot of them.</li>
<li>A <b>riddle</b> is 'a form of word puzzle designed to test someone's ingenuity in arriving at its solution'. Riddles were used as a way to both puzzle the audience and teach them to understand poetic language. Due to Voldemort's past being 'a riddle' until the trio discover he was T. M. Riddle in the second book, it is only logical that he would be named that; moreover, <a href="/wiki/J._K._Rowling" title="J. K. Rowling">J. K. Rowling</a> reportedly once saw the grave of one 'Thomas Riddell' in Greyfriars Kirkyard, <a href="/wiki/Edinburgh" title="Edinburgh">Edinburgh</a>, which is probably the origin of the name. Voldemort created his name from arranging the letters of his full birth name, known as an anagram, another type of puzzle.</li></ul>

<ul><li>He is the main antagonist of the original <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_(book_series)" title="Harry Potter (book series)"><i>Harry Potter</i> books</a> by <a href="/wiki/J._K._Rowling" title="J. K. Rowling">J. K. Rowling</a> and archenemy of <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter" title="Harry Potter">Harry Potter</a>.</li>
<li>In the <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_(film_series)" title="Harry Potter (film series)"><i>Harry Potter</i> films</a>, Lord Voldemort is played by several actors.
<ul><li>Starting from the <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire_(film)" title="Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire (film)">film adaptation</a> of <i><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire" title="Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire">Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire</a></i>, adult Voldemort is played by <a href="/wiki/Ralph_Fiennes" title="Ralph Fiennes">Ralph Fiennes</a>, who was born in <a href="/wiki/1962" title="1962">1962</a> (being 42 to 49 at the time of filming).</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Richard_Bremmer" title="Richard Bremmer">Richard Bremmer</a> portrayed Voldemort in the flashback scene depicting the murder of Lily and James Potter in the <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Philosopher%27s_Stone_(film)" title="Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone (film)">film adaptation</a> of <i><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Philosopher%27s_Stone" title="Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone">Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone</a></i>. His face (gone through prosthetic makeup and altered with visual effects) was also used for the scene in which Voldemort's face is finally revealed, though <a href="/wiki/Ian_Hart" title="Ian Hart">Ian Hart</a> (who also played <a href="/wiki/Quirinus_Quirrell" title="Quirinus Quirrell">Professor Quirrell</a>) voiced it instead of Bremmer. Archive footage of Richard Bremmer appears in the final film during the <i>Prince's Tale</i> scene, although upon close-up on his face, he is played by Ralph Fiennes.</li>
<li>In the <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Chamber_of_Secrets_(film)" title="Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets (film)">film adaptation</a> of <i><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Chamber_of_Secrets" title="Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets">Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets</a></i>, Voldemort is portrayed by <a href="/wiki/Christian_Coulson" title="Christian Coulson">Christian Coulson</a>. In the <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Half-Blood_Prince_(film)" title="Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince (film)">film adaptation</a> of <i><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Half-Blood_Prince" title="Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince">Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince</a></i>, Tom is portrayed by <a href="/wiki/Frank_Dillane" title="Frank Dillane">Frank Dillane</a> as a 16-year-old and also <a href="/wiki/Hero_Fiennes_Tiffin" title="Hero Fiennes Tiffin">Hero Fiennes Tiffin</a> as a 11-year-old, with the latter being Ralph Fiennes's nephew.</li>
<li>All in all, Voldemort is officially played by a total of seven actors: Ralph Fiennes, Ian Hart, Richard Bremmer, Christian Coulson, Hero Fiennes Tiffin, Frank Dillane and <a href="/wiki/Michael_Berendt" title="Michael Berendt">Michael Berendt</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-Michael_Berendt's_website_52-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Michael_Berendt's_website-52"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>52<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> although his scenes were cut. This makes him the character to be played by the most actors in the <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_(film_series)" title="Harry Potter (film series)"><i>Harry Potter</i> films</a>. Whether intentional or not, this also rings true for Voldemort's fascination (and J. K. Rowling's utilisation of it in the series) with the number seven.</li></ul></li>
<li>He is voiced by <a href="/wiki/Akira_Ishida" title="Akira Ishida">Akira Ishida</a> in the Japanese dub of the <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Chamber_of_Secrets_(video_game)" title="Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets (video game)">video game adaptation</a> of <i><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Chamber_of_Secrets" title="Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets">Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets</a></i>.</li>
<li>In the Flemish dub of the films, Voldemort is voiced by actor Dirk Denoyelle, who also voices Hagrid and Sirius Black. The actor claims he got the part because no other actor was willing to talk in a whispery voice during the dubbing of the first film. Though since film four, the actor has been using his normal speaking voice when doing Voldemort.<sup id="cite_ref-53" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-53"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>53<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li>Although Harry Potter only realises he's one of Voldemort's Horcruxes in the final book, Dumbledore tells him that Voldemort put a bit of himself in Harry in the end of the second book.</li>
<li>When Voldemort is seen drinking the <a href="/wiki/Unicorn_blood" title="Unicorn blood">unicorn blood</a>, he is portrayed by <a href="/wiki/Theo_Kypri" title="Theo Kypri">Theo Kypri</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-54" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-54"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>54<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li>In <i><a href="/wiki/LEGO_Harry_Potter:_Years_1-4" title="LEGO Harry Potter: Years 1-4">LEGO Harry Potter: Years 1-4</a></i>, Voldemort is the default <a href="/wiki/Boggart" title="Boggart">Boggart</a> form for most individuals in the game, whose Boggart is not described in canon, with a few exceptions. Upon the Voldemort Boggart being repelled with the <a href="/wiki/Boggart-Banishing_Spell" title="Boggart-Banishing Spell">Boggart-Banishing Spell</a>, the Voldemort Boggart will suck on an infant's dummy. Interestingly enough also in this game, despite Voldemort's Boggart being his own corpse canonically, in this game his Boggart will assume the form of <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter" title="Harry Potter">Harry Potter</a>, as his greatest fear. Upon repelling his Harry Boggart, Harry will fall down and die. This was likely due to his canonical Boggart form being too disturbing for a children's video game, the same with both <a href="/wiki/Albus_Dumbledore" title="Albus Dumbledore">Albus Dumbledore</a> and <a href="/wiki/Molly_Weasley" title="Molly Weasley">Molly Weasley</a>, who also have Boggarts in the shapes of corpses (coincidentally, both are given Voldemort Boggart forms instead).<sup id="cite_ref-legohp14_55-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-legohp14-55"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>55<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li>In the <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_(film_series)" title="Harry Potter (film series)"><i>Harry Potter</i> films</a>, the handle of Voldemort's wand resembles a bone.</li>
<li>In the city of Edinburgh, UK, near the Elephant Café where Rowling is said to have written some of <i>Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone</i>, there is a famous cemetery named Greyfriar's Kirkyard. One of the headstones for those buried outside the walls of the graveyard (due to being suicides or enemies of the church) bears the name Tom Riddell. Rowling has stated that she often walked in the Kirkyard, so this may be a possible origin of the name.</li>
<li>In the film adaptation, Voldemort is shown to have very apparent veins on the top and back of his bald skull. Due to the veins' pattern, this was misinterpreted by some viewers who took it to be a scale-like motif and one of the features of Voldemort that had begun to resemble a snake after he began creating his Horcruxes.</li>
<li>In French, Vol de Mort can mean 'flight from death', which reflects his obsession with immortality. It can also mean 'Theft of Death', which is reminiscent of the <a href="/wiki/Death_Eaters" title="Death Eaters">Death Eaters</a>' name.</li>
<li>Although J. K. Rowling has said that Voldemort is pronounced without the 't'<sup id="cite_ref-ReferenceA_49-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-ReferenceA-49"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>49<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> in the books, the first character to say the name in the series is Hagrid, whose dialogue is often spelled phonetically (e.g. <i>'go boil <b>yer</b> heads, both of <b>yeh</b>'</i>),<sup id="cite_ref-PS4_56-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-PS4-56"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>56<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> and the 't' is printed when he says it as well. The letter <i>is</i> also pronounced in the film versions. During a reading of one of her books, Rowling herself  pronounced Voldemort with a 't'<sup id="cite_ref-57" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-57"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>57<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> (but did not at another).<sup id="cite_ref-58" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-58"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>58<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li>In <i><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Chamber_of_Secrets" title="Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets">Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets</a></i>, Voldemort said that his father abandoned his mother when he found out that she was a witch, when he really left after <a href="/wiki/Merope_Riddle" title="Merope Riddle">Merope</a> stopped giving him <a href="/wiki/Love_potion" title="Love potion">love potion</a>. Of course, this may have been how <i>he</i> saw the events, an attempt to twist them to justify his hatred of Muggles or simply his best guess as he might not have realised Merope used the potion. It could be possible that if not before, then possibly after Merope stopped giving her husband the potion, that her being a witch was stated and proven. Based on the words he speaks to Harry in the Little Hangleton graveyard, he indicates his father was anti-magic 'he didn't like magic, my father', which could have been revealed during a possible conversation between father and son when the young Voldemort confronted his muggle father and grandparents.</li>
<li>In 2001, <a href="/wiki/Christian_Coulson" title="Christian Coulson">Christian Coulson</a> was cast as Tom Riddle in <i>Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets</i>, even though he exceeded the age group <a href="/wiki/Chris_Columbus" title="Chris Columbus">Chris Columbus</a> had set for auditions. Before Coulson was cast, <a href="/wiki/Eddie_Redmayne" title="Eddie Redmayne">Eddie Redmayne</a><sup id="cite_ref-59" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-59"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>59<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joseph_Morgan_(actor)" class="extiw" title="wikipedia:Joseph Morgan (actor)">Joseph Morgan</a> auditioned for the role.<sup id="cite_ref-60" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-60"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>60<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-61" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-61"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>61<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup> When Coulson later expressed interest in returning for <i>Half-Blood Prince</i>, <a href="/wiki/David_Yates" title="David Yates">David Yates</a> felt Coulson was 'too old' to play the role again. <a href="/wiki/Frank_Dillane" title="Frank Dillane">Frank Dillane</a> was eventually cast in Coulson's place. Archive footage of Coulson as Tom Riddle was used in <i><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows:_Part_2" title="Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2">Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2</a></i>.</li>
<li>In the <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Half-Blood_Prince_(film)" title="Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince (film)">film adaptation</a> of <i><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Half-Blood_Prince" title="Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince">Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince</a></i>, Tom Riddle was played by <a href="/wiki/Hero_Fiennes_Tiffin" title="Hero Fiennes Tiffin">Hero Fiennes Tiffin</a> at age eleven and <a href="/wiki/Frank_Dillane" title="Frank Dillane">Frank Dillane</a> at age sixteen.</li>
<li>When Warner Brothers was casting the role for the <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire_(film)" title="Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire (film)">film adaptation</a> of <i><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire" title="Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire">Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire</a></i>, rumours circulated that both Rowan Atkinson and John Malkovich were considered. Both rumours were proven to be false.</li>
<li>In the Danish version of the <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix_(film)" title="Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix (film)">film adaptation</a> of <i><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix" title="Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix">Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix</a></i>, <a href="/wiki/Albus_Dumbledore" title="Albus Dumbledore">Albus Dumbledore</a>, voiced by <a href="/wiki/Nis_Bank-Mikkelsen" title="Nis Bank-Mikkelsen">Nis Bank-Mikkelsen</a>, calls Voldemort Tom instead of Romeo, which is his Danish name. The writers behind the Danish script made a mistake.</li></ul>

<ul><li>In the first film, Voldemort's eyes are shown to be red, as it is stated in the books. However, in the <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire_(film)" title="Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire (film)">film adaptation</a> of <i><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire" title="Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire">Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire</a></i> and subsequent film adaptations, Voldemort has light blue eyes, so that they would 'show more emotion' than if they were red. Also, young Riddle has dark eyes (as described in the books) in the <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Chamber_of_Secrets_(film)" title="Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets (film)">film adaptation</a> of <i><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Chamber_of_Secrets" title="Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets">Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets</a></i> but light blue eyes in the <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Half-Blood_Prince_(film)" title="Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince (film)">film adaptation</a> of <i><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Half-Blood_Prince" title="Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince">Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince</a></i>. Interestingly, Harry's eyes were also changed from their much-emphasised colour in the books to Daniel Radcliffe's natural light blue.</li>
<li>When BBC Newsbeat published an article titled 'Why people are calling American businessman Donald Trump Voldemort' due to his suggestion that all Muslims should be banned from entering the United States of America, J. K. Rowling tweeted that Voldemort was 'nowhere near as bad'.<sup id="cite_ref-62" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-62"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>62<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li>J. K. Rowling explained that Voldemort went after Harry instead of Neville because he identified with the half-blood boy and therefore decided he must be the greater risk.<sup id="cite_ref-ReferenceB_63-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-ReferenceB-63"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>63<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li>In <i><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows" title="Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows">Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows</a></i>, during his final duel with Harry, he is seventy-one, which is the reverse of seventeen, Harry's age at the time (another possible representation of them being the antithesis of each other). Though his original body 'died' at the age of fifty-four when he tried to murder Harry Potter as an infant. Presumably, his resurrection in <i><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire" title="Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire">Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire</a></i> gave him a new fifty-four year old body. His soul, however, tortured and distorted it finally became, would be seventy-one. Otherwise, if he was a total newborn, he would have been three years old when he was finally defeated.</li>
<li>In the <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire_(film)" title="Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire (film)">film adaptation</a> of <i><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire" title="Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire">Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire</a></i>, he is shown with a forked, <a href="/wiki/Snake" title="Snake">snake</a>-like tongue, but in the <a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix_(film)" title="Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix (film)">film adaptation</a> of <i><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Order_of_the_Phoenix" title="Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix">Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix</a></i>, his tongue is normal.</li>
<li>Voldemort is described in the books as having cat-like slits for eyes, which is changed in the film. However, after he emerges from the cauldron in <i><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Goblet_of_Fire" title="Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire">Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire</a></i>, the slits can be briefly seen.</li></ul>

<ul><li>Mary GrandPré's illustrations for the American edition of Harry Potter describes him with a <b>green</b> skin, rather than the pale skin described in the books, and also with many alien/reptilian-like attributes.</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/J._K._Rowling" title="J. K. Rowling">J. K. Rowling</a> has said that it is of important symbolic significance that Voldemort, incapable of love himself, was conceived in an act of coercion, rather than genuine <a href="/wiki/Love" title="Love">love</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-64" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-64"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>64<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li>When asked if Voldemort affected the <a href="/wiki/United_States_of_America" title="United States of America">American</a> wizarding community, <a href="/wiki/J._K._Rowling" title="J. K. Rowling">J. K. Rowling</a> said he would but his plan was <a href="/wiki/Europe" title="Europe">European</a> domination first.<sup id="cite_ref-65" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-65"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>65<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li>In a <i>Fantastic Beasts</i> interview, Rowling said that even though fans had a sense that Voldemort was a threat to the whole wizarding world, fans never saw how he was affecting people in the rest of the world.<sup id="cite_ref-66" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-66"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>66<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/J._K._Rowling" title="J. K. Rowling">J. K. Rowling</a> revealed that after his death, Voldemort had to exist in the <a href="/wiki/Limbo" title="Limbo">limbo</a> Harry talked to Dumbledore's <a href="/wiki/Soul" title="Soul">soul</a> in, as the crouched human childlike form, and was therefore unable to return as a <a href="/wiki/Ghost" title="Ghost">ghost</a>.</li>
<li>In the film adaptations, despite characters still calling him 'He-Who-Must-Not-Be-Named', 'You-Know-Who', or (in the case of Death Eaters) 'The Dark Lord', more characters call him by his name than in the book. <ul><li>In the book, it only says that Voldemort's curse rebounded on him and that the Elder Wand flew from his hand to Harry's. In the film, Voldemort dies when his Killing Curse begins filling in the fissures of the Elder Wand, and then his arms begin to turn black, causing him to disintegrate into ashes as he dies. It was, however, intended to be similar to the book, and was also included in late stages of development, although it was changed to the depiction in the final version after the events of Osama bin Laden's death.
<ul><li>This also fits well the <a href="/wiki/Death_Eaters#Behind_the_scenes" title="Death Eaters">spectre-like attributes that Death Eaters were given in the films</a>.</li></ul></li>
<li>Tom Riddle is the only named Slytherin <a href="/wiki/Head_Boy_or_Girl" title="Head Boy or Girl">Head Boy</a>.</li>
<li>A 100-foot tall representation of Voldemort was included as part of the opening ceremonies of the 2012 Summer Olympics in London, during a presentation celebrating English children's literature. He was presented as leading fellow villains the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Child_Catcher" class="extiw" title="wikipedia:Child Catcher">Child Catcher</a>, the <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Queen_of_Hearts_(Alice%27s_Adventures_in_Wonderland)" class="extiw" title="wikipedia:Queen of Hearts (Alice's Adventures in Wonderland)">Queen of Hearts</a>, <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cruella_de_Vil" class="extiw" title="wikipedia:Cruella de Vil">Cruella de Vil</a>, and <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Captain_Hook" class="extiw" title="wikipedia:Captain Hook">Captain Hook</a>, before being defeated by an army of <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mary_Poppins_(character)" class="extiw" title="wikipedia:Mary Poppins (character)">Mary Poppins</a>.</li>
<li>Oddly enough, despite his obsession with <a href="/wiki/Immortality" title="Immortality">immortality</a> and use of <a href="/wiki/Horcrux" title="Horcrux">Horcruxes</a> to achieve it, Voldemort died having lived an average <a href="/wiki/Non-magic_people" title="Non-magic people">Muggle</a> lifespan of 71 years old.</li>
<li>In the books, Voldemort's voice is frequently described as being cold and high, but Fiennes uses an occasionally deep voice, particularly when Voldemort is yelling or casting curses.</li>
<li>Voldemort had been rejected twice when applying for the job as teacher of <a href="/wiki/Defence_Against_the_Dark_Arts" title="Defence Against the Dark Arts">Defence Against the Dark Arts</a>. However, Voldemort shared the body of <a href="/wiki/Quirinus_Quirrell" title="Quirinus Quirrell">Quirinus Quirrell</a>, who was from that time a teacher of Defence Against the Dark Arts for a year.
<ul><li>It is remarked in the story that the turban Quirrel wears smells foul, and most presume it is to protect him from a vampire he encountered in the Black Forest. It is later revealed that Voldemort was possessing Quirrell, and the smell was possibly owing to him.</li>
<li>Ironically Quirrell's story about a vampire is in some respect true, as Voldemort at the time was in a state between life and death, and himself admits that he is living parasitically off of the weaker man. This even includes making Quirrell drink the blood of <a href="/wiki/Unicorn" title="Unicorn">unicorns</a>.</li></ul></li>
<li>Ralph Fiennes' favourite line in the series is 'I can touch you now' from <i>Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire</i>.<sup id="cite_ref-77" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-77"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>77<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li>His birth year, 1926, is a year of the Tiger on the Chinese Zodiac sign. He possesses qualities that are often associated with those born under this sign: independence, bravery, ambition, an aggressive attitude, a tendency to be over-confident at times, a short temper, and the ability to charm and seduce others.</li>
<li>In the practice of numerology, his date of birth gives him the number seven as his 'life path number'. He once mentioned to Horace Slughorn that seven is the most magical number. His personality includes traits that those with this life number are said to have: being aloof, preferring independence, lacking concern for others, and intimidating others.</li>
<li>Curiously, Riddle began studying at Hogwarts in 1938, one year before World War II struck, and graduated in 1945, the year the war ended and the same year Dumbledore gained mastery of the Elder Wand after defeating Grindelwald.</li>
<li>In an interview with the <i>Fantastic Beasts</i> cast, <a href="/wiki/Zo%C3%AB_Kravitz" title="Zoë Kravitz">Zoë Kravitz</a> says she believes, if Voldemort and Grindelwald got into a magical duel, that Voldemort would win. However, <a href="/wiki/Callum_Turner" title="Callum Turner">Callum Turner</a> was unsure and stated 'But, Harry took him down'.<sup id="cite_ref-78" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-78"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>78<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li>When asked by a fan if Voldemort liked cake, Rowling says she doesn't see him as a great <a href="/wiki/Cake" title="Cake">cake</a> lover and that she suspects he reached a point of inhumanity where he didn't actually need food.<sup id="cite_ref-79" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-79"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>79<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li>In the German version, the only canon source that pronounces Voldemort's name canonically (with a silent t) is the first audiobook version read by Rufus Beck. The second audiobook version read by Felix von Manteuffel, as well as all films and video games, pronounce it with an audible t.</li>
<li>Ironically, Voldemort's name would later be used for <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Voldemort_(distributed_data_store)" class="extiw" title="wikipedia:Voldemort (distributed data store)">a distributed data storage system</a> that was for key-values, similar to Voldemort and his Horcruxes.</li>
<li>Despite dying at the age of 71, it is likely that he was biologically younger, given that he was left without a body for 13 years, and received a new body in 1995, when he would have been 68. He was 54 two months from 55. So if this is true he would have been roughly 57.</li>
<li>In <i><a href="/wiki/The_LEGO_Batman_Movie" title="The LEGO Batman Movie">The LEGO Batman Movie</a></i>, Voldemort appears as one of the many villains trapped in the Phantom Zone. Curiously, he is not voiced by <a href="/wiki/Ralph_Fiennes" title="Ralph Fiennes">Ralph Fiennes</a>, even though another major character in the film (Alfred Pennyworth) is; instead he is voiced by <a href="/wiki/Eddie_Izzard" title="Eddie Izzard">Eddie Izzard</a>.</li>
<li>For <i><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows:_Part_2" title="Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2">Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2</a></i>, director David Yates was unsure how to present Riddle's eventual death. Due to the film being shot in 3D, Yates elected to shoot two different versions of his death. The first version has Riddle collapsing to the ground after the final blow. The other take was shot in a way that would allow the effects to break Riddle into many floating pieces. While the latter would make the final cut, a production photo from the film reveals the other take.</li>
<li>Tom Riddle is voiced by <a href="/wiki/Dave_Wallace" title="Dave Wallace">Dave Wallace</a> in <i><a href="/wiki/Harry_Potter:_Magic_Awakened" title="Harry Potter: Magic Awakened">Harry Potter: Magic Awakened</a></i>.<sup id="cite_ref-IMDb_80-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-IMDb-80"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>80<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li>
<li>In the Japanese dub of the film adaptations, Voldemort refers to himself with the pronoun <i>ore-sama</i> (俺様) rather than the casual <i>ore</i> (俺) or the neutral/semi-formal <i>watashi</i> (わたし). <i>ore-sama</i> (lit. "the honourable me") is considered to be a very narcissistic way of referring to oneself, and it fits the character very well.</li>
<li>Actor James McAvoy had auditioned for the role of <strong class="mw-selflink selflink">Tom Riddle</strong> in the early parts of his career, and he was interested because it offered "a ton of money. It was like 40 thousand pounds or something like that". However, it would have meant for him and 10 other people to be put on retainer for seven months, where he was not allowed to work then in case the studio called him to film his role. On the advice of his agent, he dropped out of consideration.<sup id="cite_ref-81" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-81"><span class="cite-bracket">[</span>81<span class="cite-bracket">]</span></a></sup></li></ul>
